218001.name: SUD-20: The Simplistic Universal D-20 Roleplaying Game
rpg: SUD-20: The Simplistic Universal D-20 Roleplaying Game
218001.description:
From the introduction:

This is SUD-20 a "rules light" D20 Roleplaying Game that uses a lot of the traditional d20 statistics and basic rules (as seen in Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition), but in a more simplistic way to just play any type of Role Playing Game setting without worrying heavily about rules and still getting to roll that sweet 20 Sided Die that many know and love.

218002.name: Campo Bello
218002.description: A fun, abstract family game for 2-4 players that adds a multiplayer twist to the traditional peg solitaire game. To win Campo Bello, remove your pieces from the board first. Pieces are arrayed in four triangular home areas that surround a center diamond. Pieces are removed by jumping - jumping one's own piece causes the jumped piece to be removed. Jumping an opponent's piece allows you to remove any of your pieces from the board.

218003.name: In Bleakest Midwinter
218003.description:
Holiday Fun For All

A Holiday Adventure

From the introduction:

It may as well be you. You are among the elite of Santa's elves, the Stealth Operations Brigade of the North Pole, simply called Santa's S.O.B.s by those in the know. Ensuring holiday cheer for people around the world doesn't come easy. Sometimes, you have to get your hands dirty. Santa Claus can't get his hands dirty. He needs plausible deniability for some of his most important work.

That's where Santa's S.O.B.s come in. They get their hands dirty.

218004.name: Pokemon Rummy Card Game
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
218004.description: As a Pokemon themed version of rummy, the object of the game is to be the first player to earn 100 points by making matches and runs. The game features round pokeball-backed cards that are numbered and suited like traditional cards and can be used for other card games. It comes with rules for a Pokemon variant of Rummy in which runs are created with different evolution stages of Pokemon characters, aces are wild cards, and jokers allow you to take a card from another player's hand. These four joker cards feature characters from the first season of the Pokemon TV series: Ash, Misty, Brock, and Team Rocket and the represented Pokemon are all from the Kanto region: Bulbasaur, Ivysaur, Venusaur, Charmander, Charmeleon, Charizard, Squirtle, Wartortle, Blastoise, Pidgey, Pidgeotto, Pidgeot, Pikachu, Raichu, Ekans, Arbok, Clefairy, Clefable, Jigglypuff, Wigglytuff, Meowth, Persian, Koffing, and Weezing.

218006.name: Sunless Sea - Zubmariner
218006.description:
More of the deep, compelling world of Sunless Sea and Fallen London, packed with stories and secrets. Dive into unplumbed abysses and claim their eerie blessings. Seek immortality.

More beautiful, hand drawn art. Let your curiosity take you to what lies beneath the Sea of Statues, Mount Palmerston, and the dread Dawn Machine.

Convert your ship into a Zubmarine and dive anywhere in open water to discover new cities, zee-beasts and environments to terrify your crew and slake your hungers.

11 new underzee ports, each with their own tales and opportunities for the enterprising Trespasser. Visit Dahut, the city of drowned delights. Brave Wrack, where a Fair King rules the unforgivable. Explore Anthe, and sharpen your tongue, your liver, and your spleen.

Seek immortality in a new ambition! Track down the Seven Against Nidah, who once came within reach of eternal life. Can you succeed where they failed?

New enemies to face, from the cunning Wreckship to the inexorable Constant Companion.
Discover the treasures the zee has claimed. Explore ancient wrecks, avoid hostile witherweed, discover the unexploded Unclear Bomb.

Sanity is scarcer. Death is closer. We warned you, Trespasser. You should not have come.

Source: The Developer Website.

218007.description:
Napoleon's Quagmire - The Campaign in Extremadura, March-November, 1809 (battles of Medellin, Talavera, Almonacid, and Ocaña) is the VII volume of the games from OSG's THE LIBRARY OF NAPOLEONIC BATTLES series.

The Year 1809 began with Napoleon’s departure from the Iberian Peninsula, to face the Austrian threat on the Danube. He left his brother, Joseph, in nominal command of his armies in Spain, as puppet king in Madrid. Fighting flared on several fronts simultaneously, and the French occupation had some successes, notably at the siege of Saragossa, concluded by Marshal Lannes just before his departure to join the Emperor.

In 1809 the French under Joseph nearly mastered the plains of Old and New Castile. However, the Napoleonic magic could not work at such distances (a dispatch sent from Vienna to Madrid, would travel 2,400 km in 12 to 14 days); when dispatches arrived they were often days or weeks out of date. A series of battles were fought during the course of the year along the approaches to Madrid from Portugal, where the future Duke of Wellington had just arrived with a small British Army to second the Spanish Army of Extremadura.

COMPONENTS

Two full-size color maps (22"x34" each)and two half-size maps (17"x22")
Rulebook (28 pages)
Scenario Folder (24 pages)
Two counter sheets (560 units)
Two decks of cards (50 cards each, 100 total)
15 player aid cards




Series scale
The Library of Napoleonic Battles - formerly known as the Napoleon's Last Battles (NLB) Series:

480 meters per hex,
1 hour per turn,
400-800 men per strength point.
218007.name: Napoleon’s Quagmire

218010.name: Ultraverse: Prime
218010.description:
User Summary

A scrolling beat 'em up that was scheduled for release on the Super Nintendo. It is based on the Prime character from Malibu comics.

It was originally envisioned as a SNES game but was never completed. It was eventually released as a Sega CD title as a pack-in with Microcosm, a game that was released separately before. The game design has the typical SNES feel, with no changes made to match the advanced options of the Sega CD platform. Compared to the SNES prototype, even though the graphics style is the same, the fighting style is slightly different and a 7-minute rock theme song was added along with the bonus features mentioned above.

218011.name: Count up MAMBO!
218011.description:
Description from the publisher:

The Fastest Card Game!! (maybe). MANBOU(Sunfish) x MAMBO!! High speed battle in 60 sec. >

You must place your cards quicker than other players on the rules to the field.
And you bring up a MANBOU(Sunfish) from an EGG to an ADULT FISH.
You win if your card’s points are less than other player’s when GAME is OVER.

218012.name: Gem Duel
218012.description:
Description from the publisher:

Gem Duel is one of the card game to duel with your opponent, using variety beautiful cards of sealed creatures into GEM.
These creatures are from myths around of the world.
You and your opponent summon each 3 creatures one by one, sort each summoned creatures , and battle at the same time.
You win by direct attack to your opponent after destroying all of his shields.

Note : You can destroy the shields and attack directly in same color creature’s battle only.

218014.name: Orc Office Party
218014.description:
Orc Office Party is a quick card game for 2-4 players per deck with games lasting an average of 15-30 minutes wherein players compete to survive in an office environment managed by dastardly orc supervisors.
In this card game, players take on the role of an employee scrambling to survive the most hostile work environment, a company run entirely by orcs! Along with surviving the dangerous traps and time consuming assignments, players compete to see who can slack off the most and still remain employed at the end of the work week. Players begin with timecards, each one representing an hour they can slack off and still get paid.

The game plays 2 to 4 players with the base deck. It only takes about 5 minutes to learn, and only about 15 minutes for a single game.

218015.name: The Most Brilliant Mage
218015.description:
Description from the designer:

The Most Brilliant Mage is a short CCG-like game for two players that can be played with a standard deck of cards. In the game, the players are Mages casting spells and summoning the elements to fight for them.

Each turn, players cast spells and/or summon elements in an attempt to have the most power in play. Players are fighting a tug-of-war for points, similar to games like Twilight Struggle, and if a player gets to 3 points, she wins.

The game was designed to mimic the more meta-decisions involved in CCGs while being able to be played with just 18 cards. Strategies like Aggro and Control are present in the game. There are also options for pre-built decks and drafting.

While it does not have the depth of true CCGs, The Most Brilliant Mage is a brain-burner that can scratch that same itch.

218016.name: Godzilla: Kaijuu Daikessen
218016.description:
User Summary

A tournament fighting game featuring monsters from the Toho movie series.

218017.description:
Description from the publisher:

“This is a rebellion, isn’t it?”
–Jyn Erso, Rogue One

The Star Wars saga has always centered on the timeless struggle between good and evil. At different points throughout the saga, evil may be lurking in the shadows or controlling an oppressive, galaxy-spanning Empire. Yet there must always be balance in the Force, and whenever the dark side rises, a spirit of rebellion begins to light the way forward.

With the new Spirit of Rebellion Booster Pack for Star Wars: Destiny, 160 brand-new cards enter the game, incorporating elements from every movie in the saga, but with a special focus on the newest Star Wars movie: Rogue One. You’ll find plenty of characters from Rogue One within this set, including Jyn Erso, Chirrut Îmwe, Mon Mothma, and Director Krennic, alongside other iconic characters from across the Star Wars story. The spirit of rebellion has ignited, so prepare to bring the feverish battles and kinetic action of Rogue One to your games of Star Wars: Destiny!

Every booster pack includes five randomized cards and one premium die, broken down into three common cards, one uncommon card, and one rare or legendary card with a corresponding die. All cards that feature a corresponding die are either rare or legendary cards. With every booster pack, you’ll find new characters, supports, upgrades, or events, along with new ways to enter the Star Wars galaxy and fight for your chosen side!
218017.name: Star Wars: Destiny – Spirit of Rebellion Booster Pack

218018.name: The Fool's Sphinx
218018.description:
From publisher blurb:

The gods created Sphinxes to guard their sacred places, treasures, and knowledge. Varied in form and function, they serve as a reminder of the power of deities over the world. In remote swamps and badlands dwell a failed creation of some forgotten pantheon of gods - where most Sphinxes are noble and powerful creatures with a sacred mission, these craven creatures serve only themselves and rarely guard anything of consequence. Scholars call them Fool’s Sphinxes, but they call themselves the Parosphinx.

A grossly oversized human face, lolling tongue, and bedraggled fur cover the creatures, who have the legs of a hoofed beast like a goat and a flowing tail and mane like a horse. Comically undersized bat wings hang limply from their shoulders, allowing limited flight despite their seeming uselessness.

The Parosphinx’s most dangerous trait is their seeming unawareness of their own absurdity. Believing themselves chosen by the gods for glorious purpose, they impose themselves upon everything around them, using a magically augmented facility for speech to back up their requests for petty luxuries at the expense of others: Fresh-baked breads, pastries, fruit juices, alcohols, plush pillows, tapestries, and finely crafted furnishings.

In spite of their piteousness, Parosphinxes are actually powerful diviners capable of contacting the primal forces of the universe: Their connection to the divine is real. Someone who fulfills one of their absurd requests can force the creature to use its divinatory powers on their behalf, receiving an answer direct from the cosmos. A Parosphinx often sets itself up as a petty oracle to backwater and unsophisticated peoples - remote humans, goblins, hill giants, and ogres often form cults surrounding a Parosphinx.

Lizardfolk often live in the same swampy regions as Parosphinxes and so know them well for what they are. Lizardfolk kill the creatures on sight, never allowing them to speak. A Parosphinx will often use its Piteous Complaint ability to conscript adventurers as diplomats to make peace with locals they’ve previously wronged, like Lizardfolk.

218019.name: The Curse of Partelisa
218019.description:
From Introduction:

The Curse of Partelisa is an adventure designed for use with the fifth edition of the world’s first fantasy role-playing game. It is intended for four to six characters of third level and can be completed in a single gaming session. Depending on the number of characters and the challenges met, the characters should gain a level at the end of this adventure. As this is a classic dungeon-crawl, a variety of character classes is strongly recommended to handle the magic, combat, and dungeoneering that will be necessary to successfully survive the dungeon and lift the curse. The adventure is set in the extreme southern tip of the continent, a place where rugged and rocky deserts bake between the boundaries of the tropical ocean on either side. The land here is stark, yet possessed of an abundance of life if you know where to look; and the beauty is equal to any mountain or forest the players have seen, with great stone monuments and
high plateaus giving way to valleys of copper-colored stone and bright green cacti.

218020.name: Aeries of the Aevekar
218020.description:
From publisher blurb:

"The wars of the Ground Walkers have taken their toll, too many of our people lie dead and broken on the cold hard earth. We must, for our own sake, retreat and take stock -- our place is the high aeries of our forefathers, the give of Zavonis" ~ Kelos Nom Zerinian: 1741 A.C.

The history of the Aevekar is fraught with these winged fae dying on behalf of those who walk the earth. They were once found everywhere on Shaintar, yet there are now only a few thousand left hidden in secret communities in the most difficult locations. The Kal-A-Nar Empire has declared genocide upon them after the death of the Emperor's favorite sone so this may not be a bad thing.

Even though scattered, some few leave the aeries each year to take their place among the Rangers, or fight alongside their fae brothers and sisters against any evil focused upon the land. In this book, you'll leanr the story of what happened to these folk and how they've survived. There's some new gear, edges, professions and you'll get a good look at what their lives are like within their homes. Scattered they may be, but these are among some of the best bowmen ever seen and they created aerial combat. Take a tour of the aeries and learn a few secrets about the most hidden of them all - one no aevekar would ever admit exists.

Learn of their food, drink, society and what they find entertaining or artistic. It shouldn't be surprising that wind instruments feature prominently in their music. While they aren't militarily inclined, everyone learns to fight and serves as protection for the aeire they live in. Their death rituals are particularly beautiful given their close relationship with Zavonis, Ascended of air.

218021.name: The Lucanii Drift
218021.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lucanii Drift - A Starships & Spacemen campaign.

Set deflector screens to maximum! All ahead full!

High above the main galactic arm lies a brilliant stream of stars - the Lucanii Drift. Separated from the Confederation by a hazardous wilderness of storm-swept space, the Lucanii Drift is only now being entered and explored.

Player characters crew a Confederation starship. Their mission: to chart the unknown star systems of the Drift. To explore its new horizons. To make first contact with alien species, and to support the fragile Confederation colonies.

But all is not as it seems. The Drift is haunted by old enemies - and even deadlier ancient secrets...

The Lucanii Drift is a sandbox campaign setting for the Starships and Spacemen RPG by Goblinoid Games. It can be easily used with any science fiction rules that allow player characters to ‘boldly go’.

Inside this book:

Expanded starship combat rules
New Equipment
New character races
Additional character generation rules
Rules for improving and developing starships
15 sectors to explore, filled with conundrums and discoveries.
Hundreds of encounters and adventures




Dust off your red shirt - and on to adventure!

218022.name: Fabulous Archetypes
218022.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Adventuring Life! You don't have to be Fabulous to get the most out of it, but it helps!

So often adventurers are all piled together; armored, bloody, brooding over spellbooks, yelling about curses and demons... why not try to be fabulous, both in the sense of being part of fabled story, and fabulous in demeanor. Aaron Hollingsworth and Purple Ducks' Fabulous Archetypes gives you six new archetypes across the class spectrum that break the mold for adventuring direction. Check out the Unicorn Rider cavalier, the versatile Feyfriend and his fey companion, the groovy Flower Child druid, and truly charismatic Ensorcellor mesmerist. The dynamic Holistic monk will keep your party going and the Jolter wizard archetype will keep monsters at bay!

218023.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells VII (PRD)
218023.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 7th-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

218024.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells VII (3PP)
218024.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 7th-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

218025.name: The Little Flower Shop
218025.description:
Description from the publisher:

You're working for the little flower shop in the heart of the village. To attract customers, you'll need to arrange the most beautiful display of flowers in the shop's window.

The Little Flower Shop is a light, yet strategic, auction and push-your-luck set collection game featuring stunning artwork by botanical artist Sarah Wry. In each round, players bid for flowers in a unique auction mechanic that adds a touch of "push-your-luck" to it. When you overbid another player for flowers, you flip another flower token. If the tokens in this group contain three flowers of the same color, the player receives a penalty. The flower tokens must be arranged in each player's shop window to maximize the impact. The player who bests arranges their display will be the most respected florist in town.

218026.name: Infinite Caves of the Shroom Goblins
218026.description:
From the introduction:

The Infinite Caves exist on their own little sub-plane (thus explaining the horrible mapping confusion that will occur when the characters start exploring). Access is by a magic portal, and for all we know there may be nearly infinite numbers of these portals on the prime material plane, but they all enter the caves in the same manner, dumping the party out in between the mirrors in area 10 of the caves.

218027.name: AD&D Monsters: Apsara to Zebez
218027.description:
From the introduction:

A collection of thirty-six foes, fiends, and friends.

218028.description:
Description from the publisher:

Play Dirty – and get a Reaction!

You can pack a lot of fun into a small box, especially when you pack it full of microbe meeples. I’ll say it again. Meeple Microbes (squeeee!)

In this nasty little 2-5 player game, your boss, Dr. Lillian Johannae has made a groundbreaking discovery in the field of microbiology. She has discovered a new breed of extremely unstable, highly volatile microorganisms, BIOTIX™ (patent pending and pronounced ‘biotics’) that can uneasily coexist within a small system. Now she needs supporting data. But science can be a brutally competitive field. What began as an innocent pursuit of discovery has quickly devolved into self-centered posturing and ruthless backstabbing among her lab personnel, all vying to have their name attached to the research paper, thereby rocketing them you into scientific superstardom.

Your mission, carefully grow the largest culture of BIOTIX you can in your petri dish – and sabotage the work of others by pushing their microbe populations above their limit, causing them to explode and bio-react in all sorts of fun ways. Game play is simple: on your turn, draw two BIOTIX from the specimen bag and place them, one at a time, either into your own dish for points or into an opponent’s dish to try and force a bio-reaction to destroy their work.

Each of the five BIOTIX species has a different trigger number and a unique bio-reaction when they ‘go off’. It may force you to trash the microbes, force microbes from your dish into the petri dishes of others, steal microbes or wipe out a species across the whole table. The BIOTIX are in a constant state of flux throughout the game, as is your score, because at the end of the day you gain points for the BIOTIX remaining in your dish, with the most volatile BIOTIX being worth the most points.

The best score over 3 days of research determines the winner! Then try the advanced game, with Aggressive BIOTIX, a cancer-like organism that mimics the properties of the BIOTIX they replace in your dish – except they are worth negative points instead of their usual values.
218028.name: BIOTIX

218029.name: AD&D Monsters II: Alp to Xana
218029.description:
From the introduction:

A dozen new monsters inspired by Folkore and Myth.

218030.name: The Abbey of St. Martin
218030.description:
An adventure for low-level characters

From the introduction:

A few years ago, not from the village, an order of monks established a modest abbey under the Rule of St. Martin. In addition to the normal work of monks, namely prayer and a little bit of farming, the Martinians cultivated an orchard of peach trees and sponsored the village's annual Festival of Peaches. The abbey fell to marauding orcs and ogres. So terrible were the desecrations perpetrated by those monsters that the abbey was never reclaimed even after the orcs and ogres were driven from the region. Today, the abbey stands, overgrown by weeds and vines, crumbling and largely open to the elements.

218031.name: Siege at the Temple of Gorush
218031.description:
A Pits & Perils Adventure for 1st - 3rd level characters

From the introduction:

Fifty years ago, orcs from many tribes terrorized the Duchy of Highcastle, preying on helpless peasants, burning good cropland, and otherwise disrupting the King's revenues in this formerly prosperous region. All efforts to eliminate the threat failed, and the orcs grew bold. As a final insult, they built a temple to their chief deity, Gorush, in the hills of Westhampton, not a day's ride from the old abbey of Saint Gilbert.

218032.name: The Tombs of the Whispering Worms
218032.description:
A Descent into Madness

From the introduction:

The whispering worms are a race of intelligent, subterranean non-arthropodal invertebrates. Decadent, cruel, and possessing powerful psychic abilities, the whispering worms abducted surface dwellers, bringing their victims down into their lightless realm as slaves and food. The reign of the whispering worms ended so long ago that most today believe the monsters to be little more than old wives' tales.

218033.name: The Town of Bridgepuddle
218033.description:
An adventure for 5th - 8th level characters

From the introduction:

Bridgepuddle is a remote town in northwestern Serd. It thrives as a result of its robust trade in high quality, uncommon exports. It is a curious place, filled with eccentrics and odd specialty shoppes. It is also about to become ground zero for the zombie apocalypse.

218034.name: The Necrophidian Journals Rust Edition
218034.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This "Rust Edition" is a taster for the printed versions of the books, which are primarily intended to be roleplaying game aids, where the fantastic worlds of your imagination are to be created and recorded, whether that be maps, sketches, or notes.

218035.name: The Necrophidian Journals Black Edition
218035.description:
From the introduction:

Better-looking graph paper for your games! A Mapping Journal for Fantasy Cartographers. A game aid for players and game-masters alike.

User summary:

Includes:


40 pages of 5mm square grid
40 pages of hexagon grid
40 pages of isometric square grid

218036.name: The Necrophidian Journals 5mm Square Grid Edition
218036.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Better-looking graph paper for your games! A game aid for players and game-masters alike. As a player, draw out the maps that you discover in your games as you go. Keep as a record for future. As a game-master, design your adventuring locations. Add notes about the monsters, traps and treasures. Maybe even plan an entire campaign within this book.

User summary:

Includes 122 pages of 5mm square grid.

218037.name: The Necrophidian Journals Isometric Grid Edition
218037.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Better-looking graph paper for your games! An Isometric Square Grid Adventure Journal for Fantasy Cartographers. A game aid for players and game-masters alike. As a player, draw out the maps that you discover in your games as you go. Keep as a record for future. As a game-master, design your adventuring locations. Add notes about the monsters, traps and treasures. Maybe even plan an entire campaign within this book.

User summary:

Includes 122 pages of isometric square grid.

218038.name: The Necrophidian Journals Hexagon Grid Edition
218038.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Better-looking graph paper for your games! A Hexagon Grid Adventure Journal for Fantasy Cartographers. A game aid for players and game-masters alike. As a player, draw out the maps that you discover in your games as you go. Keep as a record for future. As a game-master, design your adventuring locations. Add notes about the monsters, traps and treasures. Maybe even plan an entire campaign within this book.

User summary:

Includes 122 pages of hexagon grid.

218039.name: d20 Warheart
218039.description:
Roleplaying in a Grim Way

From the introduction:

d20 Warheart rules were written to give me and my players the ability to play a grim d20 system RPG game in a low magic, low fantasy world. To use them, you should be experienced in any other d20 system game.

This system is not suitable for magic-sword-waving-fireball-throwing-dragon-slaying wanna-be heroes. There are no such heroes here. All are already dead.

218041.name: Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Game - BGG Crossroads Promo
218041.description:
Dead of Winter: A Crossroads Games - BGG Crossroads Promo is a pack of 5 crossroads cards generated by the BoardGameGeek community, and officially printed with the kind help of Plaid Hat Games. The cards included are:


Board Games (created by BGG user Exoow)
The Other Colony (created by BGG user MarissaDanielle)
Fourth Wall (created by BGG user spitfire23bc)
Damsel Dilemma (created by BGG user BeardedOne)
Sherlock (created by BGG user Winter_Neko)

218042.name: Operation Musketeer
218042.description: Operation Musketeer is a wargame based on the assumption that the 1956 Anglo-French-Israeli invasion of Egypt turned into a major superpower confrontation in which the forces of the Soviet Union and United States became involved. Historically, the invasion was ended because both the USSR and USA opposed the Allied invasion. But, the assumption here is that, instead, both Moscow and Washington were drawn into the conflict and deployed combat forces to support their respective camp. The game system emphasizes command control. Each side is composed of different contingents. Players activate their contingents through the use of Command markers. This models the historical command-control factors involved in multi-national operations during the 1950s. Players command ground and air forces, and there is the possibility of nuclear war breaking out. There are two players: the Allies (including France, Britain, Israel and the US); and the East Bloc (Egypt, USSR).

218043.name: Slaughterville II
218043.description:
Slaughterville II brings to the never quite peaceful town 6 brand new Locations and 4 new Villains! This stand-alone expansion can be easily integrated into the original game and is presented in a larger box to hold all of the current and future content.

Locations:
The Mall
The School
The Museum
The Sewers
The Ski Lodge
The Mines

Villains:
Doctor Frankenstein
Cthulhu
Dracula

218044.name: Opaque War: Ukraine 2014
218044.description: Opaque War: Ukraine 2014 is a simulation of the military conflict between the Ukraine government and the Donbass rebels (the People’s Republic of Donetsk and the People’s Republic of Luhansk). Game play begins in April 2014 when the Ukrainian government launched the so-called Anti-Terrorist Operation (ATO), to assert its control over the rebel provinces. There are two players in the game: The Ukrainian government player and the Donbass Rebel player. The Ukrainian Government player assumes the role of the commander of the Ukrainian Regular Army and the nationalist militias, police, and border guard forces. The Rebel player assumes the role of the commanders of the breakaway republics of Luhansk and Donetsk and (eventually) Russian support units.

218045.description: Mike Force is a solitaire wargame covering US Special Forces Operations in South Vietnam’s I Corps and adjoining areas of Laos during the Vietnam War. In Mike Force, you play the Free World forces (US, ARVN, Laotian) while the game system controls the Communists (NVA, VC). Communist mobile forces will advance towards critical Free World bases and cities, and if they take them, can win the game. You as the Free World player must use a combination of defensive operations to delay the Communists while your offensive forces hit them in their bases, represented by static units. By so doing, you can turn the tide in I Corps—and since this is a critical nexus for the Ho Chi Minh Trail, the entire War in Vietnam.
218045.name: Mike Force

218046.name: Cold Start: The Next India-Pakistan War
218046.description: Cold Start: The Next India-Pakistan War (CS) is a strategic-level, two-player wargame of low-intermediate complexity that covers the campaign that could occur if the Indians decide to try for the big win over long-time opponent Pakistan. The title comes from the fact “Cold Start” is the phrase used by the Indian military to describe their officially declared policy of eschewing the first use of nuclear weapons in any future war with Pakistan. The game’s sub-systems are crafted to present a supreme-commander’s-eye-view of such a war. It’s therefore almost fully strategic in its perspective, with only the most pastel of operational and tactical undertones added to enhance its tone and texture in those regards. CS takes two experienced players only about two hours to complete, and it’s adaptable for solitaire play.

218047.name: Life of Black Tiger
218047.description:
Life of Black Tiger is an interactive adventure story game is set in jungle, field, and forest surroundings. You can have a vivid and realistic experience through in various missions.

Source: [www.playonegames.net The Publisher Website].

218048.name: Pain Train
218048.description:
User Summary

Shoot your way through 12 gore packed levels.

218049.name: Hull Breach!: Xeros Orbital Shipyards
218049.description:
Originally released as part of Hull Breach!'s Corporate Wars box set, this individual deck has been revamped and improved for the current edition of the game.

Commander, nobody can compete with the industrial might that stands behind you. Xeros Engineering produces ships and heavy weapons better than anybody else can – we expect you to leverage this production to further the company's aims. Most of your enemies will have difficulties supplying and maintaining battle groups with heavy combatants out on the frontier, so put your trust in the captains of your heavy-hitters. They and their Marines won't let you down.

218050.description:
In the cooperative, press-your-luck game Hotshots, crews of 1 to 4 players take on the roles of wildfire fighters — crew boss, spotter, swamper, and sawyer — with special abilities, then roll dice on burning terrain tiles to match the combinations shown on those tiles. The more faces they roll, the better they fight the fire. Players can choose to cut firebreaks, which protect tiles from embers blown by wind gusts, or push their luck to reduce flames and possibly even generate reward tokens. If players bust and fail to match at least three of the six symbols on the tile, the fire grows. Another option is to maneuver vehicles — air tanker, helicopter, and brush rig — to save the forest.

Flame tokens are added at the end of each player's turn by the draw of a fire card, which can bring about light or strong wind gusts, increase the strength of the flames on certain tiles, and start fires. Too many flame tokens will cause a tile to scorch and be lost. Losing a terrain tile could also affect the game play. Some tiles are tied to crewmembers' special abilities, while others help the firefighters, and still others cause the fire to spread in unique ways. If eight tiles scorch or the fire camp scorches, the game is over and the forest is lost — but if the intrepid crew can extinguish the fire, the team wins together.

The press-your-luck mechanism with ratcheting rewards creates tension, and the variety of ways to fight the fire makes for interesting choices. The modular tile layout and fire cards bring high replayability to the game, and the acrylic flame tokens provide an enticing table presence.
218050.name: Hotshots
boardgamepodcastepisode: WTG7 - What The Geek?! Podcast Episode Four : Nintendo Switch, Trailerpalooza, Lemony Sneaky Travelers, and so much more!

218051.name: Hotshots: River Tile
218051.description: Hotshots: River Tile is a single tile for use with the Hotshots base game that provides a firebreak due to the river that ends to three of the six edges.

218052.name: Toon-in Radio Game
218052.description:
This mid-1920s game can be used in two ways. The board has six concentric tracks, one per player, each named after a popular radio set or circuit brand: Neutrodyne, Armstrong, De Forest, Crosley, Radiola and Super-H. There also are six D6, marked with the starting letters of the six brands. The board is divided radially into 16 spaces, each with the call letters and city of a major radio station.

The first game is a simple roll-and-move affair. Each player gets a small metal radio horn or "loud speaker". All the dice are thrown at once, and each player moves ahead as often as his or her starting letter shows up. First player to complete the circuit wins.

The rules booklet also suggests a second game called Toon-In Radio Golf. This requires an actual radio set as well as a copy of the game for each player. Players have to use their radios to try to tune in each of the game's stations in turn, waiting until an announcement of the call letters to verify that he has it right. The first person to successfully tune in all of the stations wins.

The game includes the call letters, city, wavelength and power of each signal. (Even the biggest stations used only 1,000 watts!) The rules note that in those days, listening to radio was like golf, with all sorts of hazards like static, amateur transmitters and lightning interfering with clean reception.

218053.name: A Madness Most Discreet
218053.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers become bounty hunters when they’re hired to track down a group of men intended for local women, but who’ve instead escaped with crew of the transport that brought them. Can the course of true love once again run smooth? Or will an ambitious baroness spell death for love and adventurers alike?

A Madness Most Discreet is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds

218054.name: Biome
218054.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers are hired to recover illegally-transplanted animals. Can they accomplish their mission in the face of hungry predators, xenophobic natives, and a near-fanatical nature-lover?

Biome is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218055.name: Breakout!
218055.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs are asked to help restore order and security aboard a stricken prison transport.

Breakout! is designed for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic — including the Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game — starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218056.name: Data In Flight
218056.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs are put in the sights of a tyrannical regime when they’re made custodians of endangered scientific knowledge. How far will the rulers go to suppress such knowledge?

Data in Flight is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218057.name: Emblem
218057.description:
From publisher blurb:

A strange artifact is at the intersection of tribal prophesy and expansionist ambition. Will the coming conflict turn the PCs into diplomats, or soldiers?

Emblem is a one-page, no-frills adventure for science-fiction systems using 2D6 as a mechanic and starring a group of characters of varied career backgrounds.

218058.name: Flight of Orphans
218058.description:
From publisher blurb:

The team finds their ship a hotbed of intrigue when they accept a contract to provide a humanitarian transport for a group of war orphans. One of the passengers and even one of the children aren't what they seem. But which ones? And who's trying to kill them?

Flight of Orphans is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218059.name: Girkekaashur
218059.description:
From publisher blurb:

A deceptively easy delivery job lands the adventurers in the middle of a battle between law enforcement and a brutal Syndicate.

Girkekaashur is a one-page adventure for Cepheus Engine (or other science-fiction systems using 2D6 as a mechanic.) Designed as a one-shot, it can easily be slotted into an ongoing campaign.

218060.name: Harvest of Wrath
218060.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs, in the course of helping to market an advanced piece of farming equipment, must stop the thing when a rival causes it to run amok.

Harvest of Wrath is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218061.name: Immersion
218061.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers face danger from a dormant volcano during an attempt to salvage valuable artwork from a sunken vessel. Or will they first fall to a salvage crew with a prior claim on the wreck?

Immersion is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218062.name: In Defiance of the Stars
218062.description:
From publisher blurb:

The team is hired to prevent an autocratic ruler from escaping the planet in a disguised starship. Will the PCs' efforts ensure that the tyrant doesn't escape justice -- or simply get them killed?

In Defiance of the Stars is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218063.name: In the Name of the Dead
218063.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes are hired by a cleric of a minority religion on a war-torn world to transport a cenotaph memorializing victims of a massacre. As they travel through a country of guerilla forces, trigger-happy loyalists, and panciked civillians, can they prevent their names from being added to the memorial?

In the Name of the Dead is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218064.name: Memoir
218064.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers are drawn into a deadly race to get an extraordinary woman to safety. Failure means the continued existence of a criminal organization with worldwide reach.

Memoir is a one-page, no-frills adventure designed for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic, starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218065.name: Miasma
218065.description:
From publisher blurb:

An industrial accident at the starport puts a community of natives at risk from a toxic cloud. The evacuation effort pits the heroes against the clock, criminals, and skittish natives.

Miasma is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218066.name: Battle on Deck!
218066.description: You're the Pirate Captain, and you live or die by your Ship. Your field is the deck of your Ship. Your opponents' fields are theirs. Each player draws cards to form a hand consisting of crew, cannons, field effects, and outside influences, and attempt to use the cannons to sink the other ships. Crew can fire the cannons, shoot pistols at opposing crew, repair the ship, and bandage wounds. Using each crewmembers special skills and talents, you have to keep your ship afloat while doing your best to send everyone else to the bottom of the sea.

218067.name: Sword of Zeme
218067.description:
From publisher blurb:

A corporate CEO hires the heroes to stop terrorist activity against his facility and to rescue his kidnapped son from them. Investigating, the PCs discover that the situation isn’t as presented. As they dig deeper into the true relationship between the “terrorist” leader, the industrialist’s son, and the animosity between activists and company, they become aware of a new and unique threat, as the damage the factory is accused of causing to the environment (the activists’ casus belli) begins to take its toll in a strange and dangerous way.

Sword of Zeme is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218068.name: Praecepta Fidei
218068.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs become unwitting accomplices to a relic theft and end up in the sights of agents of an ultra orthodox religious government. Do they side with the thief who steals artifacts for profit, or the group that wants to execute him in the name of belief?

Praecepta Fidei is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218069.name: Shadow of Vengeance
218069.description:
From publisher blurb:

A disgruntled former employee of a mining firm hatches a revenge plot targeting its most profitable product. Going along with him may mean throwing away their principles...but there's a lot of profit in doing so. What will the heroes do?

Shadow of Vengeance is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218070.name: The Azimuth Parallel
218070.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes must race the clock to solve the mystery of a derelict and avert certain disaster. With time running out, their fate, and the fates of the derelict's missing crew, is in their hands.

The Azimuth Parallel is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218071.name: The Coursing
218071.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers become a zealous hunter’s prey when they intervene in an ugly domestic situation. Will their altruism be vindicated...or make them the hunter's latest trophies?

The Coursing is a no-frills adventure designed for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including the Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game), starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218072.name: The Defiled
218072.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers are hired to clear a temple desecrated by vicious animals, but the nature of the temple and the animals is the biggest surprise of all.

The Defiled is a one-page, no-frills adventure for Cepheus Engine (or other science-fiction systems using 2D6 as a mechanic.) Designed as a one-shot, it can easily be slotted into an ongoing campaign and includes a map and antagonist stats.

218073.name: The Frozen Fire
218073.description:
From publisher blurb:

An eccentric noble with exotic tastes enlists the PCs to deliver a delicacy to him. They must face dangerous animals, a hostile environment, and armed caretakers to satisfy the noble's palate.

The Frozen Fire is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218074.name: Detective: City of Angels
218074.description:
Description from the publisher:

Detective: City of Angels, set in the dark and violent world of 1940s Los Angeles, is a game of mystery, deception, and investigation for 2–5 players. Most players will step into the shoes of LAPD homicide detectives, hungry for glory and willing to do whatever it takes to successfully close a case, even if that means intimidating suspects, concealing evidence, and hiring snitches to rat on their fellow detectives. One player, however, will take on the role of The Chisel, whose only goal is to stall and misdirect the detectives at every turn using bluffing, manipulation, and (often) outright lies.

Detective: CoA uses the innovative ARC (Adaptive Response Card) System to create the feel of interrogating a suspect. Suspects do not simply give paragraph-book responses; instead The Chisel carefully chooses how they will answer. When Billy O'Shea insists that the victim was a regular at Topsy's Nightclub, is he telling the truth or is The Chisel subtly leading the detectives toward a dead end that will cost them precious time? Detectives can challenge responses that they think are lies but at great risk: If they're wrong, The Chisel will acquire leverage over them, making the case that much harder to solve.

Detective: CoA includes separate, detailed casebooks for both the detectives and The Chisel. Each crime is a carefully constructed puzzle that can unfold in a variety of ways depending on how the detectives choose to pursue their investigations. As the detectives turn the city upside down, uncovering fresh evidence and "hot" leads, hidden suspects may be revealed and new lines of questioning will open up, creating a rich, story-driven experience.

Inspired by classic film noir like The Big Sleep, the works of James Ellroy (L.A. Confidential), and the video game L.A. Noire from Rockstar Games, Detective: City of Angels is a murder-mystery game unlike any other. Will one detective rise above the rest and close the case on L.A.'s latest high profile murder? Or will The Chisel sow enough doubt and confusion to prevent the detectives from solving the crime?

218075.name: The Guns of ak-Guurien
218075.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes find unexpected danger when they’re hired to survey ancient ruins in a war zone.

The Guns of ak-Guurien is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game), starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218076.name: The Instruments of Darkness
218076.description:
From publisher blurb:

A request to evict squatters from a celebrity’s land brings to light horrific events from 15 years prior. When the adventurers bring their discovery to light, does it make them heroes -- or targets?

The Instruments of Darkness is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218077.name: The Last Kilometer
218077.description:
From publisher blurb:

During a planetary uprising, the team helps a noble’s family to safety. Will they become heroes of the revolution, or draw its wrath by helping its targets escape?

The Last Kilometer is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218078.name: The Overlord Syndrome
218078.description:
From publisher blurb:

The PCs find themselves up against a notorious and dangerous cult when a noble’s daughter goes missing to join them. But the cult wasn't always so tough -- what happened recently to make them that way? And have the adventurers finally met their match?

The Overlord Syndrome is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218079.name: The Pollux Principle
218079.description:
From publisher blurb:

On a violent, corporate-ruled world, the adventurers are tasked with discovering the secrets of a group of extraordinary martial artists. Can they navigate the web of distrust and dishonesty, and attacks by mutates to get at the truth?

The Pollux Principle is a short, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218080.name: The Quality of Mercy
218080.description:
From publisher blurb:

A starliner’s emergency stopover at a frontier starport spells trouble for the PCs as they find themselves opposing hijackers. Which is the more dangerous: a virulent disease on board, or armed and desperate outlaws?

The Quality of Mercy is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218081.name: Theatre of Operations
218081.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers’ timely arrival may mean the difference between life and death for a group of persecuted minorities.

Theatre of Operations is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218082.name: Voices of the Bygone
218082.description:
From publisher blurb:

On a world where a new fundamentalist government is conducting a cultural purge, the adventurers are hired to locate and rescue a group of oral traditionalists declared “subversive.” Along the way they must navigate bad roads, suspicious civilians, and fanatical soldiers to complete their mission.

Voices of the Bygone is a one-page, no-frills scenario for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game), and starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218083.name: The Concrete Maelstrom: A Cyberpunk Campaign Starter
218083.description:
From publisher blurb:

A laboratory building is the target of sabotage and espionage during an extended period of unrest in the city. The PCs, employed by the lab as extra security during the citywide unrest, are tasked with helping with the defense of the building and are central to stopping the plot.

The Concrete Maelstrom is a short, system-agnostic adventure designed for a group of beginning cyberpunk characters and intended to be the pilot for a new campaign. The adventure can be used with other genres with a little work, and includes a map, NPC stats, and suggestions for further adventures.

218084.name: The Imminent Storm: A Generic Campaign Starter
218084.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Imminent Storm is a one-page generic, system-agnostic adventure intended as a spur to forming a new Player Character (PC) party, avoiding the old cliché of “you all meet in a tavern…” By throwing the new characters together in the face of an oncoming danger (specified by the GM), it avoids the awkwardness of figuring out how a group who just happen to be drinking in the same tavern will decide to go risking life and limb together.

A point-based system encourages fairness and wise choice of resources, while giving the players and the GM plenty of leeway to make decisions, The GM can even continue the new campaign based on the outcome of the adventure.

218085.name: Nature of the Beast (Generic)
218085.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can the heroes stop strange murders and sabotage at an energy production installation? Or will they become victims as well?

Nature of the Beast is a one-page, system-agnostic adventure designed for 3-5 urban fantasy characters. The adventure can be used with other genres with a little work, and includes a GM's overview, hooks to get the characters involved, and suggestions for continuing the adventure and adapting it to other genres

218086.name: Perils of the Innocent
218086.description:
From publisher blurb:

The team is hired for an emergency mission to rescue a dissident's baby from a corporate biolab. Can the heroes reunite mother and daughter, even though the corporation thinks the child's DNA is special enough to warrant kidnapping and murder?

Perils of the Innocent is a short, system agnostic adventure designed for a group of cyberpunk characters. The adventure can be used with other genres with a little work.

218087.name: Run, Rabbit, Run!
218087.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes help a rogue cop stop a courier from delivering information that could destroy an innocent person. Can they find the courier in time to prevent disaster? And what happens when the original recipient of the information feels double-crossed?

Run, Rabbit, Run! is a one-page, system-agnostic adventure designed for a group of Modern or Near-Future characters. The adventure can be used with other genres with a little work.

218088.name: Stiletto
218088.description:
From publisher blurb:

The year is 1947. When a crime boss unwittingly enlists the help of a denizen of Hell to further his plans, only the power of three ancient magical daggers can stop him.

Stiletto is a short, system-agnostic adventure designed for a group of urban fantasy or horror characters. Includes NPC descriptions, a map of the final conflict area, seeds for further adventures, and suggestions for adapting the scenario to other settings.

218089.name: The Nomad
218089.description:
From publisher blurb:

A series of strange psychotic episodes plunges the adventurers into a battle to stop an extraterrestrial incursion.

The Nomad is a one-page, system-agnostic adventure designed for a group of cyberpunk characters. The adventure can be used with other genres with a little work, and includes a GM's overview, suggestions for continuing the adventure, and advice for adapting it to other genres.

218090.name: The Purification
218090.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes go up against a fanatical hate group for possession of a deadly virus. Failure spells death for anyone the terrorists consider "impure," meaning anyone who doesn't fit their narrow ethnocentric worldview.

The Purification is a one-page, system-agnostic adventure designed for a group of cyberpunk characters. The adventure can be used with other genres with a little work.

218091.name: The Tethys Incident
218091.description:
From publisher blurb:

A seagoing research station is the setting for mysterious dealings, corporate espionage, and death, all surrounding the appearance of something extraordinary.

The Tethys Incident is a short, system-agnostic adventure designed for a tight-knit group of characters. The adventure includes a GM's overview and suggestions for adapting it to several genres.

218092.name: The Timber Beast
218092.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers investigate a series of strange deaths in and around a 19th century logging camp. What is claiming the forest over a pile of bodies? Can it be stopped?

The Timber Beast is a short, system-agnostic adventure designed for a group of Old West characters. It includes historical background of 19th Century logging camp life and operations, NPC descriptions, and suggestions for using the scenario with other settings and genres.

218094.description: Level up your game with the Champions of Midgard: Upgrade Kit! One of these kits will replace the wood and food cubes for the game (and who doesn’t love meeples?).
218094.name: Champions of Midgard: Upgrade Pack

218096.description: The first player to pass their turn receives the Participation Ribbon worth victory points at game end.
218096.name: Ninja Camp: Participation Ribbon

218097.name: Mouth Trap
218097.description: This is a light party game in which players take it in turns to read out phrases drawn from a deck of cards while wearing one of the included "Mouth Traps" which impede the player's speech. Their teammates attempt to guess the most phrases being read within the time limit. The team or player (in a 3 player game) with the most correctly guessed phrases wins and the loser must perform a forfeit drawn from a deck of cards.

218098.name: Alizaren's Castle
218098.description:
From the introduction:

WyrmWork's Maps have been created in such a way as to give the game master as much flexibility as possible. Our maps can be used with any role-playing system. The twenty maps contained within Alizaren's Castle can be used all together to make a castle with thousands of rooms or they can be used separately, or in groups, to form smaller structures.

218099.name: Bricks & Bones
218099.description:
Dungeon Maps

From the introduction:

The maps were drawn in such a way as to give the game master as much flexibility as possible. Both entrances and exits are listed on almost all maps. Single maps can be used as entire lairs or joined together to make large, sprawling complexes. They also make ideal locales for random encounters.

218100.name: Dwarven Kingdom
218100.description:
Dwarves of Rockwater

From the introduction:

The adventurer levels vary greatly depending on how the adventure is run. If the characters are generally smart, cautious, and do not feel as though they have to kill everything (they are able to choose their battles wisely) then they can be as low as levels 3-6. If the DM makes it difficult for them to avoid confrontations, or they are suicidal, they need to be at least level 10 to survive this adventure.

This is a dungeon crawl. There is no plot that comes with the actual adventure. I used it for a quest to ask for aid in a time of war from the dwarves. You can make up your own story behind it.

User summary:

The maps used in the scenario are derived from B4: The Lost City; the needed sections are reproduced in this document.

218101.name: Adventures in the Principalities of Glantri
218101.description:
Wanted: A Wizard Looking for a New House

From the introduction:

Located on the edge of the village of Fire-stoke, Glantri - just this side of the border from Wendar, Firestone Tower, previous owner one Malachi Jarno wizard extraordinaire, has been given to the village to sell, having departed for lands unknown.

We desire a Wizard (or Sorceress) of integrity, aptitude and sociable disposition to purchase and take up permanent residence.

We are the last community on the trade road to Wendar and provide services to passing merchants.

Asking price for the tower is ten thousand gold crowns.

Inquiries may be made at the Tavern.

User summary:

This minimalist adventure probably will require Dungeon Master development prior to use.

218102.name: Mystara: The Dark Ages
218102.description:
From the introduction:

It is the year one thousand two hundred after crowning. The world has changed, and unfortunately it has changed for the worse. Magic has been so greatly weakened in the last two hundred years that the shackles that held entropy at bay have been unleashed.

User summary:

This item re-imagines the Mystara campaign setting as a post-apocalyptic, low-magic, low-fantasy setting. While the adaptation was intended for use in D&D 4th Edition, it is generic enough to be used with any version of the rules.

218103.description:
In Clank! Sunken Treasures, an expansion for Clank! A Deck-Building Adventure, players explore two partially flooded maps with new dungeon deck cards, a new persistent monster to defeat, new environmental challenges, and more as they venture in the watery depths!

The challenge to prove your thieving skills has moved to new environments. You’d better know how to swim as several rooms you'll face have been completely flooded with water. Plus, of course, there's always an angry dragon to avoid...
218103.name: Clank!: Sunken Treasures
boardgamepodcastepisode: 26 Devon Dice podcast season 2 Sub Terra, sub DOOM and sub monsters
Episode 43 - Playing Campaign Games with Two
Episode 70 - Interview with Renegade Game Studios Scott Gaeta
Episode 72 - Clank with Sunken Treasures
Episode 93- Clank! and The Dark Side of Gaming: Obsession

218104.name: The Goblin War Chariot
218104.description:
From the introduction:

Barimoor is questing for immortality, and has set several plots in motion to finally bring his dreams to fruition. For the people in Karameikos this means big trouble. A rare deposit of the element known as Softstone has been found by Blackstone goblinoids living in the Black Peak Mountains, and Barimoor has contracted with them to retrieve the material. In exchange for magic items and other services the goblins have been mining the Softstone and sending it to Barimoor's underground realm. Unfortunately goblins are not hard workers, and now that they have their new magical toys they have begun using them to terrorize the countryside.

218105.name: The Beast of Radlebb Woods
218105.description:
From the introduction:

The Beast of Radlebb Woods appears as a large, powerful, demonic boar. It is actually a Traladaran warrior of the Vampire Wars, afflicted with boar lycanthropy and cursed to remain in animal form at all times.

User summary:

For 3rd - 5th level characters.

218106.name: Lords of the Cruth Lowlands
218106.description:
From the introduction:

This module is designed as a sandbox campaign adventure for mid-Expert level characters aiming at obtaining a fief in Karameikos upon reaching name level. To this end, it provides the characters ample opportunities to explore the western reaches of the Grand Duchy, obtain fame and recognition from powerful political players, and finally establish a stronghold. Even for characters who do not wish to become dominion rulers, the module provides a number of adventure hooks and patrons that can be used to drive the plot.

User summary:

An adventure for 6th - 9th level characters.

218107.name: Zpocalypse 2: Wasteland
218107.description:
Description from the publisher:

As the sun sets on another day of defending the Burbs, you can't help but ask yourself, "Is this all there is? Are we truly doomed to live out our days in this suburban purgatory?"

Players brave enough to venture out beyond their white picket fences and take to the highway in Zpocalypse 2: Wasteland, an expansion for Zpocalypse 2: Defend the Burbs, will find themselves greeted by mutants, bandits, mad scientists, and more.

Featuring a four-part campaign adventure, new survivors, weapons, locations, craftables, and terrain, the Wasteland expansion adds hours of blood curdling fun for the whole family.

218109.name: Getaway to Asia!
218109.description:
Players collect various types of resources—money, time, special gear, tour guides, etc.—that allow them to travel to cities in Asia and purchase travel experiences, which have point values. Each player starts with a randomly dealt hand of five (5) unique Experience cards, each detailing a particular travel experience in a particular city. Players are able to draw other Experience cards through the course of the game. Players purchase Experience cards from the five (5) in their hand, or from Experience cards that have already been played by other players. The five (5) Experience cards in your hand do not count for points until they have been purchased by traveling to that particular city and exchanging the necessary Resource cards for it. Only one player may “claim” a particular city and any experiences they purchase in that city. There are five different categories of Experience cards: Adventure, Sightseeing, Romance, Rest & Relaxation, and Culture & Service
The game ends when a player has purchased at least one (1) of each category of Experience card and plays their Go Home card. Players may choose to keep traveling and purchasing additional Experience cards if they wish, before playing their Go Home card to end the game. Players use the Scoring Values card to calculate their total points. The player who plays their Go Home card first to end the game scores an additional 10 points. The player with the highest point total wins.

218111.name: Xenoblade Chronicles 2
218111.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




User Summary

Xenoblade Chronicles 2 is the sequel to Xenoblade Chronicles.

218112.name: Davout in Command, 18 June 185 - What if? Scenario
218112.description:
This scenario offers players an alternative to the historical conditions of Waterloo. What would have happened if Davout had been present at Waterloo.

This scenario was included in C3i magazine, issue #29.

The contents are the two sided scenario card and the single Davout counter on the magazine countersheet.

218113.name: Sixteen Stars
218113.description:
From the back of the book:

Sixteen Stars gives a game master all the tools they need to generate adventure outlines and thrilling perils for sixteen different classic sci-fi locations. Whether delving into ancient alien temples or plunging into the human wilds of a savage hive-planet slum, Sixteen Stars provides you with the tables and techniques you need to generate a playable night's fun for you and your party of daring stellar heroes.

While Sixteen Stars was written for the Stars Without Number role-playing game, the tools in this book are conveniently system-neutral, and usable with your own favorite gaming system or sci-fi setting of choice.

218114.name: Der Schrecken des Sternenmeers
218114.description:
User summary

Der Schrecken des Sternenmeers (The fright of the Star Sea) consists of two Dungeonslayers adventures for characters of levels 8 to 12.

The first adventure starts with the characters being attacked by a ghost ship and in the second they are tasked with the conquering of a pirate stronghold.

Those two adventures can be played standalone or linked together.

218115.name: Assault on Singularity Base
218115.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Empress Tahali V, leader of the Grand Imperium, controls the galaxy with her countless legions of Imperium troopers. Clad in glistening silver armor marked with her griffon symbol, the Empress’s troopers patrol the streets of every Imperial city. But a ragtag band of rebels fights against the Imperium, their determination, bravery, and skill making up for their lack of numbers and supplies.

The rebels have recently discovered that the Grand Imperium is creating a superweapon that can destroy an entire star system. Rebel spies have tracked a prototype of this superweapon to an Imperium base—called Singularity Base— on a remote swamp world. Your group is one of six rebel teams attacking in a coordinated but desperate assault. Each team has its own objective, contributing toward the common goal of eliminating the superweapon prototype.

Assault on Singularity Base is a unique adventure that pits not one, but six groups of PCs against the Imperial forces. Run it as a mega-event with as many as 36 players and seven GMs, or choose any of the individual team missions to run for a single gaming group. This 28-page adventure was written for and debuted as the official GenCon 2016 Cypher System event, and plays great as a stand-alone scenario or as part of an ongoing space opera campaign.

218116.name: Dungenslayers Charakterbögen
218116.description:
User Summary

A pad with 50 character sheets for use with the Dungeonslayers RPG.

218117.name: MNM the music battle
boardgameversion: MNM The Music Battle First edition
218117.description:
MNM the music battle is a Musical Trivia Game with an app, an internet connection is required to play, the app has sound effects, asks the questions and keeps the score. You get a wristband to identify your color and set your name in the app.

Your aim is to collect 1000 points, by answering questions about 4 categories of music. The big MNM 1000, 90 and nillies hits, sing your song and the big hits. You get 3 cards, one red, light blue and dark blue (which are the colors of the MNM logo) and those get recognized when pressing them on the screen. It's really easy, and works extremly well. At 300, 600 and 900 points you get to pick a new category out of the 4 aviable by showing a LP shaped cardboard to the camera. Which is always identified.

Some are just questions, somtimes you need to find a cover hidden in a ton of images, or watch a clip and tell which music it is, or bleeped words out of the clip or audio clip, so it has a good diversity and also plenty of questions so you don't get them repeated often.

So the theme is music, the aim of the game is to win and show your knowledge and the whole thing is an enjoying time with friends.

218118.name: Grand Prix Electric
218118.description: A simple car-racing game with electric lamps from the `70s. If you step on a red lamp, you have to back to the start line. If the yellow lights up it means you miss a turn, but if it`s the green, you can roll the dice again.

218120.description:
Description from the publisher:

After previous Data Packs have explored the game's cyberstruggles with the settings of Luna, SanSan, Mumbad, and a New Angeles wracked by economic chaos, Daedalus Complex, the first Data Pack in the Red Sand Cycle for Android: Netrunner, turns our attention to Mars. There, terraforming is already well underway, and millions of humans live alongside clones and bioroids in a handful of cities and nodes protected by transplas domes.

With sixty cards (three copies each of twenty different cards), Daedalus Complex explores the ways that life on the Red Planet is markedly different than life on Earth. On Mars, it requires a certain ruggedness to live and work. Simply traveling outside of the protected cities requires breathing assistance and protective gear. The shared hardships of survival have led to the de facto authority of the clans, and even though the Martian Colony Wars have ended, the tensions between the clans, the Martian Colonial Authority, and the corps remain high.

Mine these conflicts for change or profit with Daedalus Complex. Mars very much remains a semi-lawless frontier… and any given spark has the potential to ignite a much larger flame.
218120.name: Android: Netrunner – Daedalus Complex
boardgamepodcastepisode: Breaking News — Episode 58

218121.description: In Dice Hospital, a worker placement game, players must treat as many patients as possible to appease the local authorities! Players use their hospital staff to treat patients on their personal hospital player boards. However, players may also call in specialist staff to react to certain situations that arise to score more points with the authorities! The game uses worker placement mechanics for the staff, dice as the patients were low scores indicate low health and a personal player board of actions to treat patients. The player with the highest reputation wins the game!
218121.name: Dice Hospital

218122.name: The Skinsuit Ritual
218122.description:
From publisher blurb:

For the Pathfinder RPG customer who wants a little more, Everyman Gaming is proud to introduce Everyman Minis! Uniting several high-quality Pathfinder RPG freelancers under a single product line, each week a different Everyman Gaming author or freelancer tackles an exciting new topic by creating a miniature product specially designed to scratch that product’s particle itch.

This installment of Everyman Minis includes: 1,000 words discussing the Skinsuit Ritual, a horrifying new occult ritual that transforms a helpless victim into a wearable disguise.

218123.name: Romance
218123.description:
From publisher blurb:

How can you add more conflict and characterization to your love story?

Story Design Volume 14 - A romance plot features the protagonist falling in love with a supporting character or even a co-protagonist. The antagonist doesn’t want this to happen, and conspires to keep the lover apart. There is often some misunderstanding or miscommunication that creates a rift in the relationship. Throughout the story the protagonist must overcome obstacles to finally be together with their one true love and live happily ever after.

Examples of the romance plot include Cyrano de Bergerac, Pride and Prejudice, The Time Traveler’s Wife, Tristan and Isolde, and Wuthering Heights.

Story Design: The Romance covers all of the elements you need to prepare in order to tell a love story. It's based on concepts explored in Story Structure for Writers and Roleplayers, also published by Dancing Light Press. It's a big book that goes into greater detail on how to get the most out of the three-act structure, as well as developing a three-phase series (campaign, if you prefer) with a clear beginning, middle, and end. If you want to use your favorite roleplaying game system to tell stories with more depth than kill monster, get treasure, repeat (not that there's anything wrong with that), it is worth looking into.

218124.name: Aqua Pura
218124.description:
From publisher blurb:

The heroes must recover a stolen shipment of water purification plant parts from rebels on a desert world. With time running out until the life-giving liquid instead brings death, the PCs must choose the proper course of action that would save thousands of lives.

Aqua Pura is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218125.name: Morian Curse
218125.description:
From publisher blurb:

After a few adventures you decide to find safety in a city setting. Along the way to Morristown you discover a few abandoned villages causing to wonder what is going on. With further investigation you quickly discover that something sinister is afoot and begin to uncover an evil cult! Can your party rescue the citizens and put an end to the nefarious religion?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a group of low to mid-level adventurers and a DM.

218126.name: Profiler
218126.description:
Profiler is a game of co-operative deduction! For example, who would care more about their looks after a parachute jump? Dracula or Lady Gaga? Discuss and show that your team is the best!

Every round, one member of the team chooses a target character (e.g., Dracula) from six. They then draw two phrases from the phrase deck and ranks them from -5 to 5. The rest of the team then judges who among the six characters doesn't match up. If the team guesses correctly, the score marker is advanced one spot and the round continues. If they guess wrongly, all cards are discarded and the next round starts. The game ends after five rounds.

218127.name: Terraforming Mars: Hellas & Elysium
boardgamepodcastepisode: 27. Devon Dice Podcast: The Balancing Act: Assassins, Beasts, Children, Designers
218127.description:
Terraforming Mars: Hellas & Elysium, the first expansion for Terraforming Mars, consists of a double-sided game board presenting two new areas of Mars:

• Elysium takes players almost to the opposite side of Mars' equator, with vast lowlands for oceans in the north and a dry, mineral-rich south. Place a tile on Olympus Mons, the highest peak in the solar system, to gain three free cards!

• Hellas, the southern wild, includes Mars' south pole and the enormous seven-hex Hellas crater that just begs to become a giant lake. Building around the pole gives you new placement bonuses in the form of heat and possibly even water.

Each of these maps consists of new sets of milestones and awards with relevance for that particular map. Place three tiles around the south pole to be a Polar Explorer, for example, or race to have the most estates beside water on Elysium!

218129.name: Décrocher la Lune
218129.description: All you need in Décrocher la Lune are a few skillfully placed ladders, a good sense of balance, and a touch of imagination. The moon waits impatiently for your arrival, but she's a sensitive lady and the smallest mistake can make her cry. The right mix of skill and luck will help you become the most agile dreamer...

218130.name: Odious Blocks
218130.description:
Description from the publisher:

This one is pretty simple… try to keep up.
Stack the blocks up three by three to build a tower.
A player starts by removing a block from the tower and choosing to either answer the truth or do the dare on the block.
After answering the truth/doing the dare, the player stacks the block on the top of the tower. Then the next player goes.
