Rampunctious is a party game about making terrible puns and word play. The game starts by the players making puns out of their own names. Whoever has the best pun becomes the Pundit. The Pundit has a hand of 5 Topic cards, they draw a Scenario card from the deck and read it aloud to start the round. Each Scenario shows a unique fictitious situation. The Pundit then plays a Topic of their choice from their hand and the players must make as many puns as possible by combining. At the end of a round the Pundit awards the Scenario card as a point to whoever made the best, worst or most puns. The game ends when a player reaches 10 points.
At any point in a game, if a player makes a pun that causes everyone to cringe they can be awarded a Cringe card as a reward. Depending on how you're playing these may count as a point.

218361.name: Artem
218361.description: Artem is a game of risk taking, careful strategy and a board that's constantly changing. Every turn players take turns either manipulating the position of color tiles or claiming a row of colors. In order to claim a row, you just need a claim card of the same color.

218363.name: The Vampire Lord of Deathblack Peak
218363.description:
An adventure for 5 to 6 characters of level 6 - 10.

From the introduction:

In this adventure, the player characters are drawn to a remote part of the world, where the sudden disappearance of a great dragon has left a power vacuum that is quickly being filled by all manner of villainy. What begins as merely an opportunity for mercenary adventurers to find coin and glory progressively becomes something more nefarious as the larger plots afoot in the region come to light.

218364.name: Hackergeist: Electronic Grimoire of Cybersigils of the Cthulhu Mythos
218364.description:
From the introduction:

The internet. It is everywhere and nowhere. Like the spirit realm. Like the Dreamlands. Like countless unseen worlds parallel to our own. It has become an alternate dimension unto itself; a living, growing system. One that cannot be stopped, or contained, or controlled, no matter what the preachers or the politicians tell you.

It has become a way for some entities to breach into our reality, to make contact with humanity; where thoughts become things, electric dreams become experiential, and vloggers become web gods.

We're not hacking systems, we're hacking dimensions.

Online. Offline.

Out of space. Out of time.

End of line.

218366.name: In the Ruins: Character Creation Guide
218366.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A new setting & a new system for The Game of the North - The Game of the North gets some class!

This guide walks you through the character creation process for the In The Ruins campaign setting -inside you'll find ways to generate a new background & outlook as well as an all new personality guide - meant to help you understand which of the 80 new character classes is right for you.

218368.name: Minions Challenge Card Game
218368.description:
It’s game on for minion-against-minion action in the Minions Challenge Card Game! Each one of these hilarious Minion characters comes with 5 cards and a game guide. Deploy your battle cards against your opponent and keep playing until your Minion reaches the top of his score card first to win! (Source: Publisher Website)

Gameplay Overview:

32 Unique Card Decks are available. Each contains 5 Cards and one Minion Figure.


Players combine 3 Unique Card Decks to form their draw deck.
Players draw 4 cards to form hand
Play cards from hand simultaneously, apply any affects
If one minion defeats the other, move that minion up one space in score track. Repeat, re-draw after every 4 cards played, shuffling as necessary.
Once all Minions (or the number of agreed upon minions) on one team have reached the end of their score tracks, that player wins the game

218369.name: Adventure II
218369.description:
User Summary

This is a 2005 sequel, originally released on the Flashback 2, to the original Adventure for the Atari 2600.

218370.name: World Guide: Zaonia
218370.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Diesel 'bots and aero cars! What's it to you?

Zaonia was a backwater, a primitive agricultural planet of no importance. Everyone knew that except the Zaonians. Building robot wonders with salvaged brains and antigravity fliers with vacuum tubes was one thing, but bucking the system that kept some planets rich and most poor was another thing. The Zaonians merely faced the Galaxy, but the Galaxy faced Zaonians.

Zaonia is a diesel punk themed world you can drop into your campaign. The World Guide has notes on the Zaonian system, history, culture and technology with adventure hooks. So throw in with the Zaonians and be a stand up guy/doll or pit your wits against them to make a bundle! The choice is yours.

218371.name: SL & VL (Issue 2 - Dec 2016)
218371.description:
SL & VL
Issue 2
December 2016

Fantasy Races
Avaruusvelhon Citadel
Laser Weapons
Strange Spells
Solifidian Lilith - the spacecraft from hell

218372.name: Crawl! (Issue 6 Character Record Sheets)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
218372.description:
User summary:

This special issue contains class-specific character record sheets for the Bard, Gnome, Paladin, and Ranger - all originally appearing in Crawl! (Issue 6 - Feb 2013).

218373.name: Crawl! (Issue 10 Character Record Sheets)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
218373.description:
User summary:

This special issue contains class-specific character record sheets for the Dwarven Priest, Elven Rogue, Halfling Burglar, and Halfing Champion - all originally appearing in Crawl! (Issue 10 - Aug 2014).

218374.name: The Sydney Razor Gangs
218374.description:
From the introduction:

June 1928. East Sydney has another name: Razorhurst.

The districts of Darlinghurst, King’s Cross, Woolloomooloo and Surry Hills are a warren of sprawling slums and ramshackle, rat-infested terraces, home to violent criminals, whores, alcoholics, drug addicts and anyone too poor to move somewhere nicer. It’s a place where you can indulge all your vices.

The swirl of criminality is founded on a slew of prohibitions: evening drinking, off-track betting, prostitution, and narcotics. These bans all offer opportunities for people prepared to go the extra mile to meet customer demand. And to fight for their piece of the pie.

User summary:

Intended for use with Malandros.

218375.name: Realms of Understreet
218375.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Kings and nobles vie for power in a swirling labyrinth of political intrigue. Warriors and wizards battle for treasure, knowledge, and adventure. Peasants and farmers eke out an existence.

Scavenge through items discarded by fearsome giants to fashion clothes, weapons, armor, and homes.

Contains:


1D100 scavenge list
Details on a number of kingdoms
Explanations of how to play as rats

218376.name: Direwild
218376.description:
Direwild is a fully co-operative, tactical, dungeon-crawling deck-builder. There is no dungeon master; it is purely the players vs. the game. Players assume the role of animists, heroes that can summon creatures both great and small (represented in the cards you build your deck with), then combine those creatures in unique ways. With the creatures' help, the animists strive to work as a team to defeat the evil forces of Karn. Karn was once a great animist himself, but was corrupted by his lust for greater power. Throughout the game, Karn tries to hunt the heroes and defeat them before they can grow strong enough to face him in the final showdown. The game is split into three chapters, with a "game save" mechanism to allow for the packing and saving of the game between game nights.

The game also includes treasure, magic, unlockable upgrades, boss fights, a large pool of minions to randomly face each playthrough, over 130 creatures, and ten unique heroes!

218377.name: Trains: Coastal Tides
218377.description:
Description from the publisher:

Trains returns with all-new cards and strategies for you to build the best rail system in Japan. This expansion not only features all new cards, it includes three entirely new boards. Two of the boards are designed specifically for 2 player games, while the Okayama map is a new challenge for 2 to 4 players. Route Bonus Cards are also included, allowing you to score additional points for being the first to connect specific stations.

218378.name: Planes: Round Trip
218378.description:
Description from the publisher:

This expansion features two new boards, providing more airports to explore. An entire deck of new playing cards allow players to experience the game with new actions and goals. New planes tokens gives players more options to customize airport boards with endless variety.

218380.name: Muumin kirjainpeli ABC
218380.description:
An educational game where children learn the letters of alphabet with familiar Moomin characters. There are seven difficulty levels which can be adjusted to match the skills of children. Contains letter tiles, player boards, dice, and game rules.

This is basically a memory game. On your turn you flip a tile, check whether it fits on your player board, then either collect cover a letter on your player board or flip the tile back. First player to cover all letters on their player board is the winner.

Easiest level is just finding matching letter pairs. More advanced variants include matching lowercase letters to uppercase letters, or matching a picture to starting letter of the picture.

218382.description:
Die Windrosen II is a six-tile mini-expansion for Carcassonne. Each tile depicts all or part of a wind rose (AKA compass rose). The orange, full wind rose is a new starting tile, and divides the playing area into two halfs.

This expansion is a reprint of Carcassonne: Die Windrosen. The artwork had been slightly changed, although it remained in the style of Doris Matthäus. The only difference compared to the original version is, that the wind direction East and West are not labelled. (Probably, to make the set language independent, as East is called Ost in German and abbreviated O.) Regarding rules and tile configuration there is no difference to the original set. Windrosen II was given as a promo with issue #5 (2013) of Spielbox.

Short rules:
Orange full rose is new start tile and defines the four quarters: SW, SE, NW, NE.
The other rose tiles are shuffled in the stack at the beginning.
Blue full rose (reg. backside) redefines the two halfs when placed.
Orange quarter rose tiles (reg. backside) are worth 3 bonus points if put down in the corresponding quarter of the playing field, e.g. the South-West rose tile put down in the SW quarter defined by the current valid full wind rose.
Appart from that the roses have no influence on the play and the features on the tiles and other points aquired through the tile.
218382.name: Carcassonne: Die Windrosen II

218383.name: Swordpoint
218383.description: Swordpoint is a “big battle” miniature wargame for fighting actions in the ancient and medieval periods. It employs multi-figure bases, various sizes of figures can be used. Games fought with Swordpoint involve between 100 and 250 miniature figures per side arranged into between 6 and 12 units. The game is designed to play out in about 2 hours after set-up, and gives a large battle feel. Swordpoint encourages the use of historical tactics and emphasises the need to maintain cohesion in the army’s battle line, without being prescriptive. Swordpoint is divided into four game phases per turn. Morale Phase, Shooting Phase, Movement Phase and Combat Phase. Combat results are decided by dice rolls with added modifiers, such as unit special rules and terrain.

218385.name: ReefGame
218385.description:
ReefGame: a role-playing game to explore livelihood alternatives in traditional fishing communities in Bolinao (Philippines)

From the introduction:

[Ten] paired players are allocated on each [virtual coastal area] and take the role of fisherman and head of family. Players' profile includes number of members in his household, income needs and boat type. Each player's objective is to provide enough food for his/her family through fishing and/or extra activity incomes.
...
The game is supported by two identical boards representing a virtual coastal area with an offshore island. Information available on the board is: the natural habitat (mangrove, seagrass, and coral) and the players' home. An Agent Based Model of the game is run during the playing sessions to compute and deliver fishing catches, players' incomes and habitat transitions.

218386.name: Magic: The Gathering – Arabian Nights
218386.description:
Desciption from the publisher:

This first-ever Magic expansion features some of the most powerful cards ever printed. Relive the tales of Sindbad and Aladdin, battle powerful djinns and efreets, and journey to strange exotic lands.

There are 78 unique cards in Arabian Nights. It features mechanics like coin flip cards, lands with abilities, djinns, and efreets.

218388.name: Magic: The Gathering – Antiquities
218388.description:
Description from the publisher:

It is a time of great peril. Ancient Thran artifacts are resurfacing in tremendous quantities, and brother vies against brother to wield their massively destructive power.

The second Magic expansion, this 100-card set offers the first story supported through both the functionality and the flavor of the cards.

218389.name: The Babylon Compulsion
218389.description:
From publisher blurb:

An implant fails, plunging a former compulsive gambler and womanizer back into a world of darkness and danger. His return to his former haunts sets off a chain of circumstances that lead to revenge, betrayal, and violence in the glitteringly dark heart of America's Sin City.

The Babylon Compulsion is a system-agnostic, noir-flavored adventure set in the near future. The plot revolves around the search for a man with a bad-boy past, the vengeful club owner he wronged, and the dangerous women who love him; set among the glitz, gambling and danger of Las Vegas.

The adventure includes a full overview of the plot, suggestions for setting a film noir tone, full NPCs writeups complete with character motivations, suggestions for mapping the scenario to other genres, and suggestions for making Las Vegas even more dangerous than it already is.

218390.name: Mtihani
218390.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers transport a planetary princess to a world where she must undergo a dangerous trial. But the planet's untamed environment is nowhere near as deadly as the many intrigues which swirl around her mother's court.

Mtihani is a one-page, no-frills adventure for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including The Original 2D6 Science Fiction Game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

218391.name: Heartbroken Heroes
218391.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero makes sacrifices to help others. Others, however, have lost far more before even beginning their lives of adventure. Included in Heartbroken Heroes are five heroes, all 7th level, who have lost friends, family, their sight, or their dignity. These heroes cannot return home, because they no longer have a place to call home. Bring your campaign to life with these fully detailed tragic heroes.

218392.name: Vacant Ritual Assembly (Issue 6 - Winter 2016)
218392.description:
From publisher blurb:

After a year of dormancy, Vacant Ritual Assembly is back!

Vacant Ritual Assembly is an underground OSR zine, directly compatible with Lamentations of the Flame Princess, but easily adaptable to other dungeon-based games. It's focused on table-useful dark fantasy content, killer artwork, and spreading the gospel of DIY gaming.

Issue #6 Includes:

Expanded Content: Over TWICE the page count of any previous issue.
Fresh Artwork from Heather Gwinn, Kathryn Jenkins, Samantha Keene, Billy Longino, Thomas Novosel, Anxy P, Sean Poppe, and Karl Stjernberg.
Grigoro's Wonders Untold: A profile of a strange travelling show and its cast of NPC misfits.
From Dunnholt It Rises: A complete adventure set on a mysterious, plague-ridden island. Written and illustrated by Kathryn Jenkins.
The Gallows on Heretic Hill: A macabre method for your dead PCs to respawn after yet another untimely end.
A Light in the Black: A profile of the Noosefriars, a heretical suicide squad faction that could easily serve as the premise of an ongoing campaign.
Death Planted the Esther Tree: A grim, mansion-crawl adventure by Kreg Mosier. Set in the world of The Driftwood Verses.
The Grimsly Hill Cherubs: Profiles a gang of youthful murderers from my upcoming campaign module, Undertow.
The Lathnos Sugar Cane Crop: Anxy P shares a hyperglycemic nightmare in the form of a very strange encounter with a magical sugar-cane field.
Emmy Allen: Of Wolves and Winter: An extended interview with Emmy Allen, creator of Wolf Packs and Winter Snow.

218393.name: Isle of the Ancients
218393.description:
From publisher blurb:

Isle of the Ancients is a Fantasy Adventure Module for 6-8 players of Levels 7-9, compatible with 5th edition D&D (Dungeons and Dragons). Isle of the Ancients can be run as a stand alone module, or can fit easily into your own campaign.

Isle of the Ancients was supposed to be a beacon of hope and unity between the races. Dwarfs were commissioned for the construction, and everything was on schedule for the first few months, and then it went quiet. Everyone assumed the worse. Months passed, the scheduled date for completion came and went, and still nothing. Those that ventured to the island reported finding nothing except an abandoned keep, or never returned at all.

Years passed, then decades, no one had the desire or means to fully explore the island. Rumors of underground caverns, treasures, magic and death surround the small island. Now only the very foolish or very brave, set their course for what awaits on this rocky island.

218395.description:
Description from the publisher:

Sine Tempore is a cooperative game in which 1 - 4 players face the game’s artificial intelligence as part of a campaign, which guides them to one of three different endings.

Sine Tempore is a game rich in high-detailed miniatures that plunge players into the planet’s alien atmosphere, guided by spectacular scenarios.

Each mission has an objective that needs to be successfully reached to determine whether or not a territory has been conquered, and whether or not new sectors can still be explored.

During the end game phase, each conquered sector will provide colonists with access to the resources they need to build new structures and equipment.

The final mission taken on by players will radically change their destiny.

Sine Tempore will take you back to a faraway past, thousands of years before Nova Aetas, exploring new worlds in search of a new home where characters can live and prosper.

During this long journey, your spaceship will come across a number of different alien species, some friendly, others somewhat suspicious or openly hostile.

In the box you’ll find 39 miniatures, 4 of which are heroes, with whom you will delve into the dangers of Primevus V, through unexplored jungles, used as hunting grounds by Primaevi and the ancient ruins of civilisation used by the latter as a resting base.
A campaign designed to be replayed with different paths each time will lead you to 3 different endings in your search for the resources you need to survive.

An efficient “end game” system will help you to develop your characters through a modern tree skill system and a tested crafting mechanism inspired by Nova Aetas.
218395.name: Sine Tempore: The Last Hope

218396.name: Deathfrolic '85
218396.description:
GriffCon AD&D Tourney

From the introduction:

Recently, the fair princess Roxanne and her three knights, Sir Riyal, Sir Carrya and Sir Loin have disappeared while traveling in the great woods of the Land. The princess must be rescued at all costs, for it is prophesied that she will in the future save the world from the Great Doom.

218397.name: The Lost Adventures Volume 1
218397.description:
User summary:

This large volume of gathered adventures is a copyright-infringing publication of previously published (almost all in Dragon), but difficult to acquire, adventure scenarios.

Each scenario notes the game system, the author, and the source. The author credits for this item entry are the credits from the original item.

Note the page sizes in the document vary by quite a lot, but usually are in the neighborhood of standard letter-size.

218398.name: Best of Greyhawk #11
218398.description:
Into the Abyss: Demons and Bloodstone in Greyhawk
Pantheons of the Flanaess: Thoughts on the Bakluni
A Fiend of Delcomben
Exploring the Forbidden City
Kingdom of Furyondy: An Alternate Campaign
Exploring Hepmonaland
Gods of the Yuan-Ti
The Orphidian Mysteries
Best of Greyhawk: Table of Contents, #1 - #11

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

218399.name: Best of Greyhawk #13
218399.description:
Elven Migrations (Elves of the Test)
Suhfang Kingdom (Oerik's Oriental realms)
Greyhawk Novels (Source of inspiration)
India on Oerth
Furyondy
What makes Greyhawk, Greyhawk?
About Gods (Ascendency)
About Gods (Worship and Divine power)
Vatun
Kelanen

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

218400.name: Best of Greyhawk #14
218400.description:
Adventures Locales (update)
Future and Gunpowder
Rhennee/Gypsy homeworld
The Way the Suel of the Scarlet Brotherhood see things.
A Load of Books
The Bounds of Oerik: Western and Southern Regions observed

User summary:

Best of Greyhawk is a series of items containing materials derived from the long-defunct "AOL/TSR Greyhawk Message Board", an electronic bulletin board system. Selections were made by long-time forum administrators.

218401.name: Sea Scourge
218401.description:
From the introduction:

Peace never lasts long in Dimgaard, but the communities throughout Dimgaard fight for a modicum of safety and often achieve that for a time. A new type of raider has landed along the coast to shatter the hopes of the residents of Dimgaard.

An Adventure for 1-8 2nd level characters; episode 1 in DGA2 Tales of Ordning.

218402.name: Seventh Cross
218402.description:
The year is 1920. Beneath the surface of society, an ancient and enigmatic Church suppresses knowledge of the supernatural to protect the greater good of humanity and retain its grip on the world. Vast conspiracies with unknown ends move in the shadows — secret societies and ancient empires — and they seek to restore the lost, mystical power of ages past. Dark magic breeds monsters within the hearts of men, which break through to the surface and consume them. It falls to the hunters of the Church to destroy these monsters before they come to light.

Take on the role of a Church Hunter, a sworn defender of the world against the forces of darkness, in Seventh Cross and delve into the heart of evil as you explore your way through ever-changing castles filled with unique narrative. Meet mysterious and treacherous characters, do battle with terrible monsters, and confront the darkness in your own soul as you walk the narrow line between the pursuit of power and its ultimate cost.

Seventh Cross is a rogue-like exploration game for 2-6 players that combines elements of paragraph adventure games like Tales of the Arabian Nights and exploration elements like Betrayal at House on the Hill together to form a Castlevania/Bloodborne/Helsing sort of narrative adventure.

218404.name: Just Desserts: Better With Bacon
218404.description: Better With Bacon is a ten-card expansion for Just Desserts that consists of six new edibles, four new customers, and one new suit: Bacon! Make new treats for folks to eat, while keeping bacon away from the vegetarian who will now come to the shop.

218405.name: No Quarter (Issue 68 - Sep 2016)
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game

218406.name: No Quarter (Issue 69 - Nov 2016)
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game

218407.name: Pagius Book of Spells Volume 1
218407.description:
From the introduction:

The Pagius Book of Spells is a Hero Kids compatible expansion that adds Spellcasting to your Hero Kids adventure.

Casting a spell is an Intelligence Ability Test with the difficulty target denoted on the Spell card.

User summary:

Contains eight spell cards intended for print-and-play use.

218408.name: Adventures in the Classroom
218408.description:
User summary:

Adventures in the Classroom: Creating Role-Playing Games Based on Traditional Stories for the High School Curriculum is a thesis presented at East Tennessee State University in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the degree Master of Arts in Reading.

While much of the thesis consists of summary research into the methodologies and outcomes of educational-based roleplaying, three of the thesis' appendices contain complete roleplaying games, all using a common basic system ("General Game System") but developed to fit specific genres and themes.

218409.name: Campus Mundi
218409.description:
Game about World Youth Day consists of 64 cards - illustration depicting the young pilgrims in scenes typical of the events of World Youth Day: among others, adoration, during a concert or gathered around the Pope's moving in the popemobile.
The task of the players is to direct the movement of pilgrims to be combined in appropriate groups, according to the dynamically changing criteria. The gameplay counts perceptiveness and speed. The game is developed in a way that does not require verbal communication between players. So they can play it by people of different languages.

Both sides of the cards are important. One of them is showing the scene with the pilgrims, the other one of the 16 features which are showed on the cards. Player one by one take card from the pile and lay out near the card pile. The top card on the pile shows what features on the cards the player are looking for. For example if the card on the card pile shows red clothes players are checking is there at least three cards with this features. If yes whoever will be the first to notice this and put his hand on the pile is the winner of the round. He will take two cards as a reward. After that next person lay out the next cards from the card pile. So feature which players have to looking for is changing continually.

The winner is the person which have the most cards at the end of the game.

218410.name: Wędrówki między Wisłą a Kampinosem
218410.description:
This is a family educational game designed for 2-4 people from the age of 8 years of age It consists in incarnating the role of a tourist who visits the 10 municipalities belonging to the Local Action Group "Between the Vistula and Kampinos." Along the way, players visit, among others, nature reserves, monuments, more or less known places, earning points and knowledgeable about the area. While wandering tourists should avoid encounters with moose and try not to disturb other visitors in exploring the beautiful countryside. The game has three difficulty options, so that pleases both the younger and older players.

On his turn player have to choose one of three actions.

First action "Gathering information" is the move and taking the one card. First move to the neighboring region is for free. For the next player have to pay in "footer". To each region one card is assignment. Card which is taken have to be hold in hands.
Second possible actions "Sightseeing" allow player to move and play cards from the hand on the table. The cards on the table will score the points at the end of the game. During this action only card from from the region where player end the move can be played.
The third action "Rest" allow player to simply take three "footer".




The cards score in five categories. The more cards you have in each categories the more point you have.

218411.name: Chevy Chase
218411.description:
This rare game is one of only two published by Hamilton-Meyers Co. of Middletown, PA around 1890.

The game is a fairly routine roll-and-move affair, with players having to move four pawns from the castle in their corner of the board toward the center. The tracks are separate and colored red, yellow, blue and black, but they do cross over one another, with a picture of various bridges in the spaces where they do.

The artwork is fabulous, featuring medieval knights in battle, castles and heraldry, all in pastel tones, with an elaborate wreath in the middle awaiting the winner.

218412.name: Al Kazar's Caravan
218412.description:
From publisher blurb:

The road to Kalliss-Morr is fraught with risks, the uruks and goblins are on the move, and in the wilderness of the Kurtish Plains it is unwise to trust to freely.

This is a beginners level adventure for warriors, rogues or wizards of up to 20 personal adds. Any kindred may be used except uruks or goblins.

Al Kazar's Caravan is a short solo adventure for use with Tunnels & Trolls. You will need a Tunnels & Trolls rulebook (preferably the Deluxe Edition) to use this book. The adventure is also compatible with the Trollhalla Press spell books.

218413.name: Havenshield: The Complete RPG Rulebook
218413.description:
From publisher blurb:

Havenshield the Complete RPG Rulebook is filled with rules on character creation, monsters, magic items, equipment, spells and magic, a setting guide to the world of Havenshield, and much much more. Havenshield is a simple 2d6+modifier Fantasy Tabletop RPG in the style of the world's oldest fantasy role playing game.

218414.name: Paola
218414.description:
This 2-player game with an 1893 copyright has a very unusual board. On each side, a rainbow of half-circles reaches most of the way to the fold in the middle. In between is a ragged checkerboard pattern of white and blue squares, with two large red squares overlapping some of the regular ones at the fold, and five orange squares on each side that connect to the outer arc of circles.

Starting at the center, the arcs are colored brown, black, blue, green, yellow, orange and red, two white lines and three rows of white hollow circles run from the middle to the edges. Within the green, yellow, orange and red bands are additional white circles, with the ones in the outer red band having white lines connecting them to the orange squares on the checkerboard.

It is not clear from the board what the rules were, but it was obviously a game of maneuver with circular and radial as well as checkerboard moves.

218415.name: Magician
218415.description:
From publisher blurb:

Smoke and Mirrors

From childhood, Clinton Sear wanted to be a true magician, but discovered all magic was nothing more than tricks and special effects. He made it his goal to prove that not only magicians, but also heroes and villains with great powers, were nothing more than tricksters.

He focused on the exploits of the most popular hero of the people: Recluse! Clinton used his special effects knowledge to simulate all of Recluse’s powers and abilities; framing the spiderpowered hero for a series of robberies in the process. Recluse eventually caught Clinton and cleared his name. In prison, Clinton joined the Crime Cartel. Now out of jail as the Magician (PL 9), he is the Cartel’s master of misdirection, executing distractions that lead away from the true goals of the Cartel.

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

218416.description:
The Embassy, an expansion for the game The World of Smog: Rise of Moloch, brings a new three-chapter campaign to Rise of Moloch and comes with:


2 Gentlemen Miniatures (Elisabeth Sparkle and Lord Baron Mantes)
3 Villain Miniatures (Lord Swanson, Ambassador Nail and Kenny Jones)
8 Minion Miniatures (Infected Constable)
1 New Campaign, including 3 New Chapters and a pack of Overlays
218416.name: The World of SMOG: Rise of Moloch – The Embassy

218417.description:
Gravehold remains the last bastion of The World That Was. As the otherworldly incursions from the creatures known only as The Nameless intensify, a cadre of strange survivors emerge from the void itself. Will they be Gravehold's salvation or its undoing?

War Eternal is a standalone game compatible with the hit cooperative deck building game Aeon's End. Players will struggle to defend Gravehold from The Nameless and their hordes using unique abilities, powerful spells, and an all new cast of dynamic characters. Featuring a number of innovative mechanisms, including a variable turn order system that simulates the chaos of an attack and deck management rules that require careful planning, War Eternal can be played alone or combined with other Aeon's End content for a game experience like no other.
218417.name: Aeon's End: War Eternal
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 24 - Kevin "QXC" Riley, pro-Starcraft player turned game designer

218418.name: Stadium
218418.description:
Stadium is a contest to see who can build the strongest professional football empire!

This is a worker placement game in which the board is a three-tiered stadium. Players must build on the ground level first as they sell concessions at games, buy equipment for the team, draft all pro players, and do their best to have a winning season. Players also hire employees who can inspire fans, sell more merchandise, train team members, and make building deals as they watch their franchise rise to the sky.

Players carefully choose business decisions, watch salaries and signing bonuses, and replace broken equipment and the occasional injured player. They gain bonuses if they choose the right actions and may end up paying extra if they are not first to build new amenities to their stadium.

218419.name: Noblesse oblige: Ett rollspel
218419.description:
1600s Swedish nobility, obligations and duties and the creation of an RPG

User summary:

This game is part of a thesis submitted as partial requirements for a Bachelor's degree in History from Linnaeus University. The thesis deal with several topics including roleplaying and historical education, and presents a simple live-action game as a sample of methods that could be used to invigorate history teaching in the high school classroom.

Note the abstract is in English, while the remainder of the document - including the game - is in Swedish.

218420.name: Mike & Joe's Card Game
218420.description:
Description from the publisher:

Mike & Joe’s Card Game is a fast-paced challenge for 2-6 players that combines THREE GAMES into one madcap session. The object of the game is to be the first player to gather seven cards of the same color, red, green or blue. Cards are accumulated through victories in any of the three games, Patter, Peril or Pointz.

Before each turn, players submit their Player Cards, face-down. Then the current player flips over the top card of the Draw Deck, the House Card, revealing the game for that turn.

If the game is Patter, the current player has but a few seconds, counted down by their opponents, to create a word from the letters on the revealed cards. They win the cards from whatever word they make.

If the game is Peril, the current player pits the Battle Icon on their Player Card against the icon on their opponent's card. If more than one opponent challenges, the player conducts Semifinals until only one challenger remains. The winner receives the Peril Prize, either two or three cards.

If they game is Pointz, the current player uses their finger to move along the board game squares on the bottom of the Player Cards. If they land on a pointing challenge, they have but a few seconds, again counted down by opponents, to point at the indicated item.

The first player to gather seven cards of the same color in their bank wins the game and is held in awe by the other players.

218421.name: Street Masters: Rise of the Kingdom
218421.description:
THE GAMEPLAY

Street Masters: Rise of the Kingdom is a 1-4 player cooperative miniatures board game inspired by classic fighting video games. Featuring over 65 highly detailed miniatures, unique decks for fighters & enemies, custom dice, and lightning-fast gameplay, Street Masters lets players match up powerful fighters against villainous organizations in a wide array of exciting scenarios. Designed by Adam Sadler and Brady Sadler, the game offers modular and elegant gameplay set in a unique and exciting world of brutal combat.

THE STORY

Warriors from around the world, known for their legendary fighting abilities and skills, receive mysterious invitations to participate in a martial arts tournament. During the tournament, the organization surrounding it reveals their true identity — The Kingdom — and their purpose to recruit fighters to join their militia or enslave those against them. While several of these warriors made it out in time, many were never heard from again.

Five years later, a government project called "Street Masters" initiates in order to counter-act the war against The Kingdom, now having divided and seized control over the world by several of its factions. Those who join the Street Masters project must work together to take down each faction, crippling parts of The Kingdom before they're able to launch their end game.

218422.name: Wing Leader: Blitz
218422.description:
(From GMT's website: )

Wing Leader: Blitz is the first expansion for GMT’s Wing Leader system. Blitz adds more aircraft and scenarios to play while expanding the game into new theaters of war. Fly Dewoitine D.520 fighters into the cauldron of battle against German Heinkels. Lead Japanese Ki-27s against the Soviets in the skies over Nomonhan. Direct Royal Navy Fulmars and Martlets at Italian torpedo bombers in Operation Pedestal. Launch P-39D Airacobras against Japanese invasion forces approaching New Guinea.

New Aircraft will also include the Soviet I-16, I-153 and MiG-3, the Curtiss Hawk 75 fighter, and most of the major French fighters including the M.S.406 and MB.152C.

Players will need a copy of Wing Leader: Victories 1940-1942 to play Wing Leader: Blitz.

In addition to new aircraft and scenarios, Wing Leader: Blitz features a brand-new campaign system, which recreates air actions in the early weeks of the German invasion of the Soviet Union. The campaign comes with its own 11 x 17” campaign map, while special markers for tracking bomb damage are included for the first time. The campaign will confront the German and Soviet players with tough decisions on targeting, attack planning and raid execution in the desperate days of Operation Barbarossa.

Wing Leader: Blitz brings the major air combats of the Blitzkrieg right to your gaming table.

218423.name: Rogue Stache
218423.description:
Rogue Stache is an action-adventure platforming roguelike which draws heavy inspiration from hits such as Rogue Legacy, Risk of Rain, and Magicite. Explore vast interstellar dungeons and defeat hordes of cunning enemies!

Source: The Developer Website.

218424.name: ToledoVR
218424.description:
User Summary

Fight your friend playing on the PC using various weapons such as meteors, bow, melee weapons and slow motion.

218425.name: Hellphobia
218425.description:
User Summary

Be prepared to face hell await ten levels of pure hardcore style, you have to use all of Michael powers to defeat the supreme Lucifer.

218426.name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Mega Battle
218426.description:
User Summary

Saban’s Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Mega Battle provides a creative and modern re-imaging of the classic multiplayer beat-em-up genre.

218428.name: Siegecraft Commander
218428.description:
Create the ultimate fortress and wreak havoc, raining destruction on your enemies with catapult-flinging fun!

Source: The Game Website.

218430.name: Hunter's Legacy
218430.description:
Hunter’s Legacy is an old-school 2D single-player Metroidvania platformer where you control Ikki, a fierce kitty skilled with twin swords and a bow, better known as the Great Huntress of Un'Amak.

Source: The Game Website.

218431.name: Toby: The Secret Mine
218431.description:
A challenging puzzle platformer inspired by games like Limbo and Badland.

Source: The Developer Website.

218432.name: Wojdan - وجدان
218432.description:
User Summary

Follow Jawad & his family on their quest to find a cure for his illness.

218433.name: Ropes And Dragons: VR
218433.description:
User Summary

Take a lot of obstacles and feed the charming dragon by his favorite candies.

218434.name: My Pet Rock
218434.description:
User Summary

My Pet Rock is a top down planet defense with rogue-lite, bullet-hell, and arcade elements.

218436.name: Imagining a Constructionist Game-Based Pedagogical Model
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
218436.description:
Using Tabletop Role-Playing Game Creation to Enhance Literature Education in High School English Classes

From the introduction:

A dissertation submitted in partial satisfaction of the requirements for the degree of Doctor in Education in Learning Technologies (Pepperdine University).

User summary:

Describes an extended methodology based on TPACK for leading high school students through a multi-week process of creating a roleplaying game based on a piece of literature. Includes detailed instructions, comprehensive evaluations, and two major examples of games created using a novel (Fahrenheit 451 by Ray Bradbury) and a play (The Importance of Being Earnest by Oscar Wilde). Presents partial transcriptions and photographs of the created games being played by the students.

Unfortunately, does not contain complete documentation of the actual games that were created.

TPACK is the Technological Pedagogical Content Knowledge Framework.

218437.name: Zealot's Guide: Book the First
218437.description:
Publisher blurb:

This initial release of the Zealot's Guide series features:

3 detailed faiths (Player's Handbook style with Spell Lists): Congregation of the Dead, The House of Solace & Parish of the Prolific Coin

9 new Divine Spells

5 New Weapons: Bolas, Lasso, Mancatcher, Net (retiarius) and Sickle

218438.name: Zealot's Guide: Book the Second
218438.description:
Publisher blurb:

The second release of the Zealot's Guide series features:

3 detailed faiths (Player's Handbook style with Spell Lists): Temple of the Three Strengths, The Home Foundation & The Courts of Inequity

85 unique new Divine spells

218439.name: Zealot's Guide: Book the Third
218439.description:
Publisher blurb:

The third release of the Zealot's Guide series features:

3 detailed faiths (Player's Handbook style with Spell Lists): Theater of the Arts, The Order of the Passionate One & The House of Vice

113 unique new Divine Spells

2 new monsters

218440.name: Zealot's Guide: Book the Fourth
218440.description:
Publisher blurb:

The fourth release of the Zealot's Guide series features:

3 detailed faiths (Player's Handbook style with Spell Lists): Church of the Night's Beauty, The Way of the Berserk & The Temple of Sleepless Nights

81 unique new Divine Spells

2 monsters

218441.name: Zealot's Guide: Book the Fifth
218441.description:
Publisher blurb:

The fifth release of the Zealot's Guide series features:

3 detailed faiths (Player's Handbook style with Spell Lists):

Parish of Love (love & harmony)
Temple of Enchantment (magic)
House of Scorn (hate & bigotry)




35 unique new Divine Spells (78 total incl. progression variants)

218442.name: Zealot's Guide: Book the Sixth
218442.description:
Publisher blurb:

The sixth release of the Zealot's Guide series features:

3 detailed faiths (Player's Handbook style with Spell Lists):

Halls of the Valiant (chivalry & valor)
The Founder's Creation (law, order, cities)
Church of Endless Night (dusk, darkness, moonless nights)




30 unique new Divine Spells (63 total incl. progression variants)

218443.description: Tormented Ally Infinitor is a promo card that was sold to celebrate the release of Shattered Timelines / Wrath of the Cosmos combined box. The oversized version is available as part of the Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards.
218443.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Tormented Ally Infinitor Promo Card
boardgameaccessory: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards

218444.description: Unstable Kismet is a promo card that was sold to celebrate the release of Shattered Timelines / Wrath of the Cosmos combined box. The oversized version is available as part of the Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards.
218444.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Unstable Kismet Promo Card
boardgameaccessory: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Villain Oversized Cards

218445.name: Card Castle
218445.description:
Card Castle is a fast-paced, slapping card game that puts your reflexes to the test. Out-slap others to win cards and rule the Card Castle! Inspired by traditional card games like War and Slap-Jack, Card Castle adds several new twists including battling armies, tricky look-alikes, powerful Wizards, and fiery dragons.

In more detail, the goal in Card Castle is to out-slap your opponents, win all their cards, and become ruler of the castle. Players take turns flipping cards blindly from the top of their army decks onto the center of the table or playmat. When slappable opportunities present themselves (doubles, doors, or wizards), the first player to slap the pile of cards wins the battle and all the cards in the pile.

But be sure you don't slap the dragon!

218446.name: Hacklopedia of Beasts II (HackMaster 5th Edition)
218446.description:
Publisher blurb:

This is it, the definitive follow-up work by the esteemed sage Greytar. Within these pages he catalogues a collection of the most varied and interesting creatures that populate the Kingdoms of Kalamar. With the aid of his fellow field researchers, they present this data for all interested readers – be they mercenaries eager to devise effective strategies for combating known foes or magicians seeking to enhance their spellcasting repertoire. Only a foole would travel the realms deprived of this valuable material.

The fruit of years of extensive travel and personal experience, Greytar presents a complete picture of every creature incorporating sketches, personal accounts, known habitats, tracker’s guides, combat tactics and yield data to round out his general observations of the beasts.


User summary:

Second volume in the Hacklopedia of Beasts series for HackMaster 5th edition.

Available as an "initial public release" PDF bundled with pre-orders for the eventual hardcover edition. The publisher notes: "The file will be incrementally updated as new monsters are added and existing ones tweaked based on reader feedback (and designer judgment). Your purchase allows you to re-download the PDF to receive updates as the document is rev'd to the final release version."

218447.name: Cha-Cha Chihuahua: The Game of Dancing Doggies
218447.description:
Description from the publisher:

Jump, jive, and wag your tail! Draw cards to get these peppy perritos to join your doggy dance-a-thon in Cha-Cha Chihuahua: The Game of Dancing Doggies.

Paw away another player's pups with some fetching food, but watch out for "siesta" cards that will send your dog-tired dancers straight to the Nap Shack! End the party with the most chihuahuas on your dance floor and you're the cha-cha-champ!

218448.name: MolecuWars
218448.description:
Description from the publisher:

Collect and battle to build a massive MolecuRing and destroy your opponent in a strategy game loaded with science facts and learning. Atomicals are at war to build the most massive MolecuRing and gain ultimate valence control! Strategy is the key element in this chemistry battle. Create your attack plan, partner your Chemicals, master your Labs and Energies, and destroy your opponent’s MolecuRing while defending your own!

This card battle game is based on the elements of the periodic table and science facts related to chemistry and physics.
CAUTION! You may accidentally learn about element groups, chemical bonds, oxidation states, chemical reactions, states of matter, energy transfer, scientific theories, and material properties.

218449.name: Kancolle
218449.description:
A Totally Unofficial Abridged English Translation

User summary:

Kancolle (艦これ) is an apocryphal fan-translation of the commercially-published Japanese-language game Kantai Collection (艦隊これくしょん).

In this peculiar game, characters are "fleet girls" - anthropomorphized naval warships. Characters are assembled into task groups and sail against opposing task groups. The game features periodic roleplaying with formalized, turn-based combat sequences.

218450.name: Kancolle Solitaire Game Rules
218450.description:
From the introduction:

The Kancolle RPG solitaire game allows a single player to enjoy going on random adventures.

Numerous rules are changed from the basic game.

218452.name: Vanished
218452.description:
Description from the publisher:

You are a wizard's apprentice, thrust into a thrilling quest to find your master who has mysteriously disappeared. Do you venture into an ominous lair, or use some warpdust to teleport to a cliff-side cave? Will you defeat the devious Dark Fairy by conjuring a catapult, or is it better to drink a super-strength potion? Your journey unfolds with every choice in Vanished, a spellbinding Cardventure in which the correct path may just be an illusion!

218453.name: Pablo
218453.description:
Welcome to the wonderful musical world of PABLO!

Pablo comes with 140 cards with words and categories in Portuguese and English, divided among wild, hard, medium and easy cards.

All players are dealt a hand of cards and can also use the cards open on the table to sing a song using the words they have available.

For every card played matching a word on the song, you get points according to the difficulty of that card. But the real fun is that anyone can jump in and sing a long with you if they have a word in their hands that is also on your song. After singing each player score the cards used.

A wild card can be used as any word that fits its categories and will be worth the number of cards you played that round in points!

Also included are the Microphone Token that will let you exchange cards, the Onomatopoeia Token that will double your points if the song has words like Yeah-Yeah-Yeah, and the Tomato Token that doesn’t has a specific rule to it other than throwing at your opponents play area when they sing a song wrong!

Components:
140 Musical Notes Cards
30 Microphone Tokens
30 Onomatopoeia Tokens
10 Tomato Tokens
30 Golden Disc Tokens
20 Platinum Disc Tokens
20 Diamond Disc Tokens
Rules

rpg: Harry Potter and the Tabletop RPG (1st and 2nd Ed.)
218454.name: Harry Potter and the Tabletop RPG (1st Ed.)
218454.description:
User summary:

Characters are defined by background, Attributes (Intelligence, Spirit, Finesse, and Power), Perks, and "Masteries" (magical performance areas).

In this amusing and charming fan-created game, characters must balance having fun with pursuing course credits to satisfy their educational plan.

218455.name: Time Raiders
218455.description:
Description from the publisher:

You are a legendary time traveler on a mission to collect both ancient artifacts and futuristic gizmos. You've got all the time in the world, so which part of history will you raid first? Do you race chariots in the Roman Empire or outwit Ben Franklin during the American Revolution? Should you face off against a futuristic robot or try to capture a prehistoric dinosaur?

The choice is yours in Time Raiders, a time-twisting Cardventure — just be careful not to alter history too much before you make it back to the present!

rpg: Harry Potter and the Tabletop RPG (1st and 2nd Ed.)
218456.name: Magical Drafts and Potions
218456.description:
From the introduction:

In this book you will find listings of every potion in the Harry Potter universe. For the most part, preserving canon will not be this book's first priority, but rather to provide potions which enhance the game and your roleplaying experience by providing as many useful concoctions as possible. Every potion which it is felt should be accessible to players can be found in this book, canon or not. However, every non-canon potion will be marked with an asterisk so that if you wish you may exclude such potions from your game.

rpg: Harry Potter and the Tabletop RPG (1st and 2nd Ed.)
218458.name: Standard Book of Spells
218458.description:
From the introduction:

In this book you will find listings of every spell in the Harry Potter universe. For the most part, preserving canon will not be this book's first priority, but rather to provide spells which enhance the game and your roleplaying experience by providing as many useful spells as possible. Every spell which it is felt should be accessible to players can be found in this book, canon or not. However, every non-canon spell will be marked with an asterisk so that if you wish you may exclude such spells from your game.

218459.name: Think n' Sync: The Great Minds Think Alike Game
218459.description:
Description from the publisher:

3… 2… 1… Sync! Meld your minds in Think n' Sync, a party game of quick connections. Pick a partner and then, at the same time, shout out an answer to the chosen category. Can you both name a movie princess? An ice cream flavor? How about something orange? Your answers may be great, but they score only if they're identical! So think quickly, think cleverly, but most importantly think in sync!

218460.name: Giant UNO
218460.description:
The classic card game now in a giant size! Each card measures 7.4 inches x 10.1 inches!

Race to get rid of all your cards and match colors or numbers.
Use the action cards or house rule cards against your opponents. When you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO"!
Play the 'Swap Hands' card to change hands with any opponent.
3 customizable cards let you write any house rule you want and erase to make new rules!

218461.name: The Big Switch
218461.description:
A fast-paced bidding boardgame designed by Balangay Entertainment.

The Big Switch is a real-time bidding and tile-flipping dexterity game about energy conservation. In each round, players try to outbid each other in 20-second auctions to buy efficient appliances for their homes, while simultaneously doing energy saving habits.

Players compete to have the most Energy Stars which they get from buying appliances and doing habits. The player with the most Energy Stars after 7 rounds is the winner!

218464.name: Mission Selfie London
218464.description:
A family of tourists arrives in London. Their objective: Explore the city and take as many selfies as they can in front of the main monuments. This race to take selfies won't happen smoothly because they'll need to answer the questions correctly — making use of vocabulary, grammar, culture, etc. — to advance and escape the traps laid by other players. Each character will have a special power.

Mission Selfie London makes learning English into a game for young players. Different difficulty levels allow the whole family to play together.

218465.description:
Contrast is a light party game in which players score points by characterizing objects the same way.

Each player has a deck of the same six cards, and each card has either opposite characteristics (short/long, round/square, etc.) or a pair of colors (red/yellow, blue/green). In each round, players simultaneously reveal one of the four cards they have in hand — as the other two cards are in front of them and cannot be used — with that card matching the top picture of the picture card deck in some way. The image might show a red balloon in the sky, for example, so do you reveal red, round, blue, or something else?

Everyone simultaneously reveals their chosen card. If a player has voted with the majority, they take a picture card from the deck to keep track of their points. Then everyone refreshes their hand by picking up their left-most card and putting down their played card on the right. Then, another round begins.

After the picture deck runs out, whoever has the most picture cards wins.
218465.name: Contrast
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 16: Verkopen & Nuernberg

218466.name: Musketeer
218466.description: Wargames Rules for Renaissance - Early Modern warfare (1490-1690). Includes rules for movement, fire, melee, morale, and optional campaign rules.

218471.name: Easy Play XXL
218471.description: 4 Easy Play games in one box plus two additional variants per game.

218472.name: Faeries
218472.description:
Description from the publisher:

Faeries race from opposite ends of the board for the safety of the central line while bombarding each other with cheese. Helpful trolls blunder about, collecting up the cheese to replenish the faeries' cheese stock, but also impede their faerie friends' progress.

The game comprises a leather board (11 x 5.5”) and hand-finished wooden pieces; with plastic dice. Each player has six faeries, one troll and six wedges of cheese. In a turn a player rolls four dice - one pink, one green and two yellow. Using the number rolled on the pink die, the player moves a faerie towards the middle safe line on the board. With the green die the player moves the troll, who can pick up cheese that has been thrown by the opposing player. Using the two numbers rolled on the yellow dice as co-ordinates, the player ‘throws’ cheese into their opponent's half of the board. Any faerie this lands on is eliminated from the game; cheese also blocks the movement of faeries towards the safe line.

Each player aims to move as many of their own faeries as possible to the central line and off the board, while eliminating or blocking the movement of their opponent's faeries by throwing cheese at them. The winner is the player who, once one player has no more faeries to move, has most faeries safe. If the result is tied, numbers of remaining faeries and cheese on the board can determine the winner.

218473.name: ReFloristation
218473.description:
ReFloristation is a new card game designed by Paul Harris and Published by Spiral Galaxy Games.

Run your own successful floristry business in this fun card collection drafting and deck-building game. Collect orders, recruit and manage staff, visit the flower market for supplies, and pack your orders off in your delivery van to earn enough money to beat your rivals’ shops. You can even plant your own nursery to get ahead.

ReFloristation is remarkably strategic and replayable - plotting your resource management, making clever choices to create the best combination of staff, and timing your moves for the best possible advantage make the game exciting and thematic. ReFloristation is suitable for gamers of all ages and abilities, whether you ever dreamed of owning a flower shop or not.

218474.description:
Description from the publisher:

Relive the fun of the arcade Crane Games in this easy to play dice game. You and your friends compete with one another to try and collect the best toys from a field of tokens. Once a player has achieved a set collection value, hidden goals are revealed and the player with the highest valued collection wins. This game features 6 custom dice and over 70 unique toys with illustrations.

Players all move around a central field of 36 toys. Within this field of Toys, several are stacked up on one another. Players have to decide if their dice will be spent on Movement around this grid or Grip, necessary for picking these toys up. Special toys allow the player a chance to push their luck.
218474.name: Greedy Claw Crane Game

218475.name: Sylvanus (ICONS)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
218475.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blacklist Files comprise the most dangerous at-large Super Talented individuals that the federal government considers to be the greatest threats to national security and public safety.

This Blacklist File focuses on Sylvanus - a fugitive, super-powred eco-terrorist

The Blacklist File series is set in the world of Extreme Earth - an Iron Age supers setting.

218476.name: Ajax (BASH)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
218476.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blacklist Files comprise the most dangerous at-large Super Talented individuals that the federal government considers to be the greatest threats to national security and public safety.

This Blacklist File focuses on Ajax (aka Peter Chobrak) a super-powered former Soviet era sleeper agent who has recently come into conflict with US law enforcement.

The Blacklist File series is set in the world of Extreme Earth - an Iron Age supers setting.

218477.name: Ajax (ICONS)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
218477.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blacklist Files comprise the most dangerous at-large Super Talented individuals that the federal government considers to be the greatest threats to national security and public safety.

This Blacklist File focuses on Ajax (aka Peter Chobrak) a super-powered former Soviet era sleeper agent who has recently come into conflict with US law enforcement.

The Blacklist File series is set in the world of Extreme Earth - an Iron Age supers setting.

218478.name: Ajax (Fate Accelerated)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
218478.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blacklist Files comprise the most dangerous at-large Super Talented individuals that the federal government considers to be the greatest threats to national security and public safety.

This Blacklist File focuses on Ajax (aka Peter Chobrak) a super-powered former Soviet era sleeper agent who has recently come into conflict with US law enforcement.

The Blacklist File series is set in the world of Extreme Earth - an Iron Age supers setting.

218479.description:
The powerful vibes of the Outside World have compromised the stability of Cerebria, and the Inside World slowly awakens from its timeless quiescence. The mighty Spirits of Bliss and Gloom arise from the deepest spheres of the Origin and strive to restore stability. With their control over the flow of Essence — the Origin’s creative energy — the Spirits evoke Emotions, Cerebria's inhabitants, to populate the regions of the Inside World and slowly shape Cerebria to their own image. Bliss Spirits dream of a Cerebria overflowing with Kindness and Joy, while Gloom Spirits are plotting to fill it with Suspicion and Animosity.

The Sprits' efforts and the infinite circulation of the Origin's Essence will lead to periods of Dissonance and Revelation, when Bliss and Gloom face each other in various ways — and the prevalent Spirits may add a fragment to Cerebria’s shaping Identity. Once completed, the Identity will finally restore the stability of the Inside World.

Leave the Outside World behind, submerge into Cerebria, and shape the future of the Inside World in the
2v2 area-control team game Cerebria: The Inside World. Impersonate Cerebria's creative Spirits associated with either Bliss or Gloom, and invoke Emotion cards with various intensities to occupy important spots on the main board, or to accompany your Spirit as it moves across Cerebria.

Emotion cards are double-sided; using Essence, they can be upgraded to their more powerful alternatives with a new, potent ability. Essence, the game's main resource, is taken from one of the Origin’s five Spheres at the beginning of your turn. The constant circulation of Essence is the core of the game. Whenever one of the Origin’s Spheres is emptied, it triggers a game-defining event before it is refilled — such as the Dissension, when Bliss and Gloom Emotions across board clash, or the Contemplation, when the allegiance of Cerebria’s territories may change. The Spirits that prevail during these events can contribute to building the Identity of Cerebria.

The Identity is built as a common effort of the two teams, and the game ends immediately once it is completed, as it grants Cerebria a permanent stability.

In the final scoring, the Identity’s composition is critical, but you can discover other ways to victory as well.
218479.name: Cerebria: The Inside World

218480.name: Ajax (M&M3)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
218480.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blacklist Files comprise the most dangerous at-large Super Talented individuals that the federal government considers to be the greatest threats to national security and public safety.

This Blacklist File focuses on Ajax (aka Peter Chobrak) a super-powered former Soviet era sleeper agent who has recently come into conflict with US law enforcement.

The Blacklist File series is set in the world of Extreme Earth - an Iron Age supers setting.

218481.name: Ajax (Supers!)
rpgsetting: Extreme Earth: A Dystopian Superhero Setting
218481.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blacklist Files comprise the most dangerous at-large Super Talented individuals that the federal government considers to be the greatest threats to national security and public safety.

This Blacklist File focuses on Ajax (aka Peter Chobrak) a super-powered former Soviet era sleeper agent who has recently come into conflict with US law enforcement.

The Blacklist File series is set in the world of Extreme Earth - an Iron Age supers setting.

218482.name: Sloven Hills
218482.description:
From the publishers blurb:

At last! Details of who and WHAT the Witch Queen Mauug is! Can the brave adventurers defeat the Witch Queen Mauug and her Army of Monsters? Will the players foolishly try and take her on while she is in her own home territory?

218483.name: Space Castle
218483.description:
Description from the designer:

Space Castle! The game of the future! (or is it the past?) It takes just 5 minutes to learn how to play and so much longer to master. Fortify your castle with 16 Warriors before the Alien ships above destroy your kingdom with "Mr. Gotcha Bombs".

You play the game alone for 20 minutes and count how many hands you have won. Afterwards, you can pass the deck to a friend and see if they can beat your score. Who will be the Ultimate Defender of the Space Castle!?

Cards are full color and printed with a spot UV on a thick 14pt stock. Includes 43 card deck, rule book, and carrying pouch.

218484.name: Murder in Stoneholme (5E)
218484.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition compatible adventure in the Underworld for four to six PCs of levels 3-4

A refuge in the underworld, Stoneholme stands neutral, its dwarves refusing to participate in any of the myriad struggles which occupy their neighbors. But, of late, evil has come to Stoneholme. Still recovering from recent supernatural events, the city now finds itself facing a mysterious killer, one whose face is never the same twice, and who leaves his victims cruelly cut and torn. The PCs must find the evidence which links the murders to the Flintblade clan, infiltrate their dark manor and bring their gruesome deeds to an end. But more than fell traps fill this dwarven home. Demonic sorcery is at work and the PCs will need all their courage and strength to survive.

Murder in Stoneholme is a follow-up adventure to Dark Days in Stoneholme, but it can also be used as a stand-alone scenario. The adventure features a series of grisly murders, a dangerous dwarven manor, demon-worshiping dwarves and a demonic, shape-shifting murderer. Though set in Stoneholme, the adventure can be easily ported to any non-evil underworld city.

218485.name: Schrodinger & Tesseract
218485.description:
From publisher blurb:

When high school students break into a mysterious lab, they are caught in an explosive accident which endows them with powers to interact in the universe beyond its standard three dimensions. With the ability to become undetectable and able to bypass physical barriers, they embarked on an exciting but short-lived career of crime. When SCHRODINGER was arrested her partner, TESSERACT, laid low. A few years later, SCHRODINGER was offered a deal for freedom. She would use her unique abilities to assist authorites in taking down other "untouchable" super beings. Anything was better than lock-up, so she agreed. Shortly afterward, her suspected partner-in-crime came forward as a new hero.

SCHRODINGER & TESSERACT are two very unpredictable heroes able to defy and break physics in numerous ways from being invisible and intangible, to seeing around corners, to manipulating four-dimensional objects in ways that radically impact the three-dimensional world.

...And maybe the occasional item might end up in a dimensional pocket. No one will miss it, right?

218486.name: Super Syndicate
218486.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strength in numbers!

The SUPER SYNDICATE is a large group of criminals who have banded together for mutual protection. With a membership of 24 villains, the bad guys in the SUPER SYNDICATE know that someone's always got their back.

Small groups of them execute their plans to pull off burglaries, robberies, and the occasional roughing up of rivals. Meanwhile, additional groups may be in hiding looking to cut-off the cops or any meddling heroes. If it all goes wrong, there are even more ready to bust their fellows out of jail!

Our first ever team book has 41 pages of sinister goodness including the background on the team, details on the preferred jobs and partners of the members, affiliated street gangs, 13 full fledged members with story ideas, and 11 minor members.

The SUPER SYNDICATE is here! Better call for back-up, heroes!

218487.name: 5e NPCs: Bullies and Brutes
218487.description:
From publisher blurb:

5e NPCs: Bullies & Brutes brings you 18 NPCs each with their own backstory, stat block and colour art. Custom abilities and unique backgrounds make this a colourful collection of NPCs for your party to encounter.

There are over 35 pages of NPC content and while all of the characters in the book are a bully of some sort, some prefer brawn and others brain; challenges range from 1/2 to 15.

This product includes the following NPCs:

Pie-Eating Pete -Human Glutton
Jaiblik Nibort - Gnome Blackguard
Eva Lurancree - Human Socialite
Lock Jaw - Half-Orc Cannibal
Butcher Bill - Dwarf Headhunter
Tuffy Brokehaft - Dwarf Boxer
Hesssk Ta’Vaoren - Dragonborn Slaver
Durgul Rampant - Half-Orc Cad
Evie Longheart - Human Fighter
Deloris Franz - Human Business Mogul
Candra Shill - Human Corrupt Guard Captain
Cobin Evresk - Half-Elf Intimidator
Elba Hasselknot - Halfling Enforcer
Vreix Azztelle - Drow Evoker
Xav Griel Drow - Mage Hunter
Kel the Blessed - Tiefling Underboss
Urden Shalespar - Dwarf Harbinger of Entropy
Lady Davia Belcouer - Human Infernal Champion




Most of these NPCs are new faces, but don’t be fooled by familiar names: any tavern favorites included have been remade to offer a new challenge level, colour art, and more backstory!

218488.name: Razorleaf Swarm
218488.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Razorleaf Swarm CR 5
2 New Magic Items: Garland of Plant Friendship, Wasp Dart
8 New Natural Items: Charda Bile, Chimera Manymind, Destrachan Harmonic Flask, Fly Eyes, Girallon Gunk, Griffon Clothes, Phase Netting, Razorleaf Shuriken

218489.name: Clutch Baseball
218489.description:
Description from the publisher:

This is Clutch Baseball–an exciting, fast-paced fantasy game. Build a team, craft the perfect strategy deck, and choose a home stadium.

The quest for the perfect deck starts here. Create a team based on a set salary cap, choose strategy cards that will solidify their strengths, and select the stadium that will give you an unbeatable home field advantage.

Every at bat includes two basic elements–the Pitch & Swing. To keep it simple: the Pitch determines who will get the advantage in the at bat, and the Swing determines the result of the at bat.

The game is played and scored just like traditional baseball using player cards that are Batters and Pitchers from real MLB teams with suitable stats on a playmat resembling a baseball field. Play a full game (9 Innings) consisting of 3 outs per ½ inning, with the Away Manager batting in the top half of the inning. As you send each batter card up to the plate, there is a pitch roll and a swing roll to determine the result (out, walk, hit, home run, etc).

Batter cards move around the bases to score runs like in real baseball. The game ends after 9 innings with the team that scored more runs being the winner - in the event of a tie you go to extra innings until one team comes out ahead!

Strategy cards played at different times give bonuses or allow you to make real baseball plays like hit-and-run, defensive shifts or even a suicide squeeze. You can use pinch hitters and runners, make pitching changes and other real baseball decisions.

218490.name: Give and Take: The Game of Soil Building
218490.description:
This is a spin-and-move affair published in 1928 by the National Fertilizer Association. The square board is divided into quadrants, each with illustrations and spaces related to a different kind of farm: Dairy Farm, General Farm, Grain Farm and Truck Farm.

The reward and penalty spaces in each quadrant have distinct explanations. In the Dairy Farm, for instance, C = "Turned cattle in pasture too early in spring. Lose 1 Spin, while on the Truck Farm this space reads "Soil very acid; limed adequately. Go Ahead 1, Take 1 Spin."

There is a separate booklet that provides more detailed information about the good and bad practices flagged on the board.

The 16"-square board itself is lavishly illustrated, although on plain beige cardboard, with images related to each kind of farm. The game was distributed in a plain brown envelope.

218491.description:
Description from the publisher:

Gorizia 1916, La sesta battaglia dell'Isonzo (the Isonzo sixth battle), is a low-medium complexity tactical game on the campaign conducted by the Italian forces against Austria, during August 1916.

This is a mini-monster, very playable game with many hundreds die-cut counters, one 22"x34" map with large hexes representing the theater of the Isonzo River, at a scale of 900m per hex, 1 day per game-turn. Each unit counter represents a battalion, or an artillery battery.

The game system is the same as its predecessor, Strafexpedition 1916﻿
218491.name: Gorizia 1916: La sesta battaglia dell'Isonzo

218492.name: Vanderuum: A Brief History
218492.description:
From the introduction:

The continent of Vanderuum is home to many beings and creatures. The lands span across the world creating both vast impassable deserts, unrelenting with their heat and strong winds, to huge unreachable mountain tops covered with snow and ice, with temperatures freezing even the most hardened of individuals.

218493.name: My Queen's Quest
218493.description:
Description from the publisher:

My Queen’s Quest is a tactical luck driven card game with 108 game cards. The pack contains 16 beautifully illustrated characters and 64 different countries. Our characters are designed by the wonderful artist Daisy Spiers. It’s supercharged, empire building Uno!

Perfect for two to four players, ages 5+, Quick to set up and 20-30 minutes of fun for all the family.

WICKED HOW TO!

To start play, you collect a Queen and once shuffled, place the rest of the deck in the centre of the players. Then take it in turns to pick a card up from the centre deck. Collect the most points to win the game. However, if you pick up a hero card you can defend against attacks or a villain card you can steal points from another player

218494.name: Used Car Lot
218494.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 40 x 40 inch, Battlemap of a Car Lot and Derelict Buildings, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“This is vandalism of the highest order. Those ganger punks have smashed up every car on my lot!”—Used Car Lot Owner

Used Car Lot is a single level exterior and interior map of a used car lot in the northwest, two abandoned warehouses to the northeast and southwest, and an abandoned drive-in diner in the southeast. This set includes four vehicles— two dirty, old used muscle cars, a shattered car, and a rusted, filthy pickup truck—and six cargo containers—three slightly used cargo containers with some dirt and grime and three rusted, weathered cargo containers.

Used Car Lot is intended for use in modern games as a rundown neighborhood or in post-apocalyptic games with the included vehicles and cargo containers for use with those genres.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

My Cars! My Cars!: A used car lot owner refused to pay protection money to the local gang and woke up to every car in his lot smashed by baseball bats and tire irons.

The used car lot owner reached out to local law enforcement but the gangers smashed all his cameras to bits as well, leaving no evidence of their crime for the police to make an arrest.

So the used car lot owner reaches out to the player characters for help with his problem after the police left after writing their report. He wants the local gang squatting in the surrounding abandoned buildings gone. He wants their faces and bodies smashed and broken like they left his poor cars. After that, he wants the buildings rigged for demolition, with the unconscious, dying, or dead gangers inside. With the abandoned buildings gone, hopefully no new gang will come to the area to take their place. These are criminal acts—assault and battery, arson, destruction of property, and murder—but the used car lot owner is willing to pay big money for his vengeance. Alternatively, he offers them a used car as payment. He can also offer them a deal to make their own car from the parts left over from his wrecked vehicles if one of the player characters is mechanically inclined and they don’t trust him to give them a good car. He’ll also pay them to fix his wrecked cars if they can as well after they do the job.

218495.description:
Description from the publisher:

“DANGER, DANGER!” The unwavering emergency voice on the loudspeaker reminds you again-and-again of the deadly airborne toxin contaminating your lab. If you’re going to survive, you’ll need to find the antidote…fast. The flash of the warning lights gives you just enough visibility to find your teammates and compare notes about what the antidote could be, but you suddenly realize there may not be enough of the antidote for all of you. Will you be willing to give-up your dose so your teammates can live?

Antidote: Lab Alliance expands the world of Antidote with five new ways to play including support for up to nine players, team-play, new turn actions and special cards, and sinister new Lab Romance characters.
218495.name: Antidote: Lab Alliance
boardgamepodcastepisode: #41: Six Awesome Uses of Dice; Roll Player on tap; Kingdomino; Noch Mal!; Women in Beer

218496.name: Dominion: Mindjammer Quickstart and Adventure Using the Traveller Rules
218496.description:
From publisher blurb:
